I liked the original too.What you get with this movie is a script that is not funny and young actors doing impressions of Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels.I was really tested to make it threw the movie.  And I failed.  Just couldn't do it.  I made it 45 minutes.Lucky me for not renting this movie - my step-son did and i burrowed it.  I asked my stepson before watching this one what he thought and he said it was ok but not funny.  Should have gotten the clue.After watching the first 45 minutes I said ENOUGH and decided to watch the extra features.  I'd get more background on why this movie was made and get clips of the parts I didn't watch.  The funniest parts were supposed to be in the beginning - of which I saw and didn't laugh.  A part where both characters play tag in a 7-11 type store and those same characters drinking a slurpee and getting brain freeze.  Horrible, Horrible, Horrible.  What has become of todays comedy?  It's all about cheap humor and is so unoriginal.So back to the extra features, the people who made this movie in the extra features acted like they had somekind of comedic masterpiece here.  They say they were looking for people who were funny and just didn't do impressions. Well all you get here is impersonations that were not funny.I've wasted enough time here on this one.  My review is to hopefully save others from watching this.  Please, don't even rent this one if you know what is good for you - it's in the bottom 100 for a reason.  That's it - goal achieved.

reviews.review_title: I give it a 3/5. Nowhere near as great as its predecessor, but still a decent movie.
reviews.content: First off, I have to say that Dumb and Dumber is one of my all-time favorite films.  I've seen it countless times and it's just as funny as it was the day I first saw it.  That being said, I was delighted to hear that a prequel was going into development in late 2002.  The fact that Carrey and Daniels were not returning was a bit upsetting at first, but the fact that it takes place in 1986 would just make them feel out of place and I was more than willing to give new actors a chance.  After the official trailer, people bashed the flick relentlessly, vowing never to watch it because it looked like pure s*** and nothing more.  I, on the hand, couldn't wait until June 13th.I was there opening day, and I have to say this is, hands down, the funniest film I've seen in a long time.  There were a few nods and references to the original, and Derek Richardson and Eric Olsen really perfected the parts of Harry and Lloyd.  Everyone seemed to love the Bob Saget cameo, myself included.  Funny, funny stuff.There were a couple of major problems, however.  First of all, there are anachronistic errors littered throughout, the music being the most distracting.  Artists like Vanilla Ice and Good Charlotte certainly were not around in '86.  Another problem is the editing.  Test audiences weren't big fans of this film, as it was trimmed down from 115 minutes to 82 minutes. Luis Guzman and Mimi Rogers had decent-sized roles, but in the final product their presence was just about wasted.  They even went as far as to delete a musical number and scenes from Lloyd's childhood (i.e. how he eventually came to live with Ray).But, despite being historically incorrect and having major editing issues, the film was still full of laughs and ends up being an enjoyable way to spend an hour and twenty minutes.

This was one of the worse movies I've ever seen. I can't think right now of a movie that was worse. I did not laugh once during this movie. It's a cheap insult to the movie going public. You saw the first Dumb and Dumber, and that was funny. I was laughing so hard during the bathroom scene that I was worried I would hurt myself. So after having seen the first one, you gotta go see the sequel, and the movie executives know this. They knew that just the title alone would fill a lot of seats, and they made absolutely no effort to make a decent movie.Throughout the movie I sat there. The lady I was with wanted to walk out. I paid $7 for myself and another $7 for her, and I'll be doggoned if I wasn't going to get at least one laugh out of it. I sat through the whole movie hoping that I would get at least a chuckle. After the first few minutes I knew I wasn't going to get a laugh worth $14, but I at least wanted something for that kind of bread. I didn't get it. I never laughed once. When I came out, not only was I disappointed but my lady friend was angry with me. I don't know what they could have done to make this movie worse.

The story of when Harry Dunne met Lloyd Christmas and they must help foil a scam as the headteacher of their school has set up a plan with their lunch lady to step up a special needs class so they can get a cheque and flee of to a better life. Harry, Lloyd and some other classmates are thrown into the mix of those who are classed as "special-needed".This film starred: Eric Christian Olsen, Derek Richardson & Eugene Levy.DUMB AND DUMBERER:WHEN HARRY MET LLOYD was released in 2003. This is a disappointing movie although both of the main characters could almost pas as Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels. However there were only a couple of laughs in this film so I don't really recommend it but this probably deserves higher than a 3.4 or whatever it has on this site.***/***** Could be worse.

It really was as bad as I predicted... Unfunny and devoid of the whackyness the first movie was endowed with through rubber-face Jim Carreys antics.
I stopped watching some time into the movie. (never bothered to check how long it kept me watching) This turkey (and it's a big one) really deserves its place in the bottom 100 movie list. And I hope it stays there too.

To be honest, I have completely forgotten about this movie, in two ways, I forgot what it was about, and that it even exists.Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry met Lloyd is a sad excuse to cash in on the very highly successful and well liked Dumb and Dumber. I applaud Jeff Daniels and Jim Carrey for not appearing or even involving themselves with this movie in the slightest sense. This is one movie I liked the first time I saw it, and then when I watched it again, it was so stupid, and I have never watched it again, in effect, I have only watched this movie exactly twice, and that is far too many. heck, even one viewing is far too many viewing.

reviews.review_title: If I could go back in time, I would stop the production of this movie at all costs!!!!
reviews.content: This movie was a complete disgrace!!! I would give this movie a 0 but that is not a number in the scale!!!! How could they ruin such a classic!!! I really don't understand how people could take one of the greatest movies of all time and put it to shame. FIrst of all, if you watch Dumb and Dumber, the amazing original, you would realize Lloyd and Harry have known each other since elementary school, NOT high school. And what the **** was up with Lloyd's father being a Spanish janitor?????? I was So confused! This "movie" (if it can even be called a movie) had a horrible plot, horrible acting, and it was just down right not funny. I was actually sobbing to see such a classic movie like Dumb and Dumber being demolished into oblivion! This movie is not even worth watching for free!!!! This movie is a complete waste of time!!! DO NOT WATCH THIS MOVIE!!! Trust me on movies!!! i am a huge fan of movies and i know what i am talking about when i criticize movies!!! If you read my other comments after watching the movies i commented, you will agree!!! Do Not Watch This Movie!!!

Look, i normally like comedies, some of the notoriously bad ones (i.e Kung Pow) are films i really liked, i just like to laugh.. and this seemed to at the very least be a bit of a laugh, i wasn't expecting the classic quality of the original.. but something!!!i got NOTHING!!! despite the great cast, Levy, various SNL and Mr.Show alumni, and not to mention the excellent imitations of the leads, i expecting at least one or two belly laughs.. all i got were a few smiles, but more often than not i was left thinking "oh" or "come on, make me laugh!"There is the misconception that writing Dumb jokes and dumb characters is easy, because its dumb.. but its the complete opposite, writing dumb takes a smart person, something the Farrelys are.. this film was just full of cliched, obvious jokes, and tried too much to try emulate the first film, and not really taking off at its own film. This film should have been a LOT better, they found people who could pull of Carrey and Daniels, and showed great potential for humour, but were let down by a very very average script, and a lazy director.Watch only for curiosity value, but just don't expect to be in even a patch of Dumb & Dumber, or even virtually any other comedy that got a theatrical release this year.PS- Shia LaBeouf is looking more and more like a young Gene Wilder, great turn in the film by him! 3/10

reviews.review_title: Why this movie does not work.
reviews.content: It is very strange that when I read the user reviews of this site, so few actually talk about why the movie is so bad. Well, I'd like to take a moment to say why I didn't, and in better detail than most, hopefully, enjoy the movie.Dumb and Dumberer is a prequel, which if the word "sequel" is of any indication, means it is a continuation from the first. Well, "Prequel" implies it as a "beginning of" story, sort of what happened in the childhoods of Harry and Lloyd, who were originally played by Jeff Daniels and Jim Carrey, respectively.The characters in the story are Harry and Lloyd, two simple minded teenagers, who lack any real charm or clever idiocy that was played so well in the original. The idea in this movie is that the principal, played by the legendary Eugene Levy (Jim's Dad in American Pie and most of its sequels) is trying to find a get rich quick scheme, so he develops a special needs class to make the money, but he needs students.If that part of the plot doesn't offend you, don't worry, the rest will.Harry and Lloyd go on a search to find kids who are just like them, (although its so insulting to think special needs kids can't tell an Asian girl from a mentally handicapped child) and needless to say, a class is formed.Jessica, a very smart teenage girl (which only implies the entire school isn't smart enough to recognize this plot) sees the ruse, and uses our heroes to dig up the dirt on the principal.To be honest, if the movie didn't have the "Dumb and Dumber" moniker or even a mentioning of Harry and Lloyd, this movie probably would have faded into obscurity, nary, even been made, and if it did, it might have been a cult classic if it had been better written and not as relying on the first movie's jokes.The movie has some references to the original picture, but the problem is that references aren't usually funny. So when this movie references the laxative from the original as a large truck carrying said product, it doesn't make it funny, you are just implying that you watched the movie enough to notice it.The problem with this movie is just lazy writing. The creators probably thought watching enough of the original was a good idea to create a sequel, but what it does is insult anyone who tries really hard to write good comedy with insulting retreads from classic movies.Harry and Lloyd aren't some kind of smart, they are all kinds of moron. In the original, it is implied they aren't smart, but in reality, it's that their ideas of intelligence is slightly askew from most people, but it was mostly honest mistakes. Lloyd hearing the country Austria and playing it off as Australia is believable, and more than likely a mistake a person has made before, as opposed to say, talking about who Benjamin Franklin is (Where Lloyd explains that Ben Franklin was the "Pilgrim who invented Penicillin and defeated Godzilla").Critics and most writers will tell you that was is usually funny isn't funny, it's what you play off as serious that's funny. The characters aren't serious people doing funny things, they are played off as funny people doing funny things, and that doesn't always equal funny.The actors seem rather detached from the project, as if they all simultaneously had a large bill to pay, so they played their appropriate roles just to pay it off to do better movies. It was strange that from the years 2003 and 2005, people thought that making sequels to previous Jim Carrey movies was to be cinematic gold, was actually just copper painted up and advertised as gold.It is always going to be argued that sequels are never better than their original counterparts, and that's understandable, only so many movies have that bragging right. That doesn't mean if you have an idea for a sequel and you feel strongly in making a sequel that you have to do it poorly in every means possible: in writing, in acting, in character development, music, staffing, ETC. It should be room to improve. A sequel, in particular, a prequel should challenge the audience to see how the characters became who they are when we remember them, not putting them in a less than original story.This concludes my review, I give it a 2/10.

I loved the first, despite the fact that it too, was pretty, well for lack of imagination...dumb.  But Dumb and Dumberer...man.  The plot was awful, the script not far behind.  The only bright spots in the movie were the two guys playing the leads.  They were VERY convincing as Harry and Lloyd.  But still, the movie was painful to watch.  I spent most of the night wondering why I was charged $6 for a tub of popcorn worth 30cents at the most.

reviews.review_title: Oh, no!! Another teen movie cleverly disguised as a sequel to a GOOD movie!
reviews.content: Aw, man...this never should have been done.  A sequel for "Mallrats" would've been more interesting.  The jokes here are almost funny, but suffer the Nutty Professor 2 phenomenon.  They are pretty much the same as the first one, with a few twists to make them seem interesting.  For instance, remember that hilarious scene when Harry gets diarrhea at Lauren Holly's character's house, and then she tells him that the toilet is broken?  Well there is one such scene in this movie, only this time Harry buys Jessica a chocolate bar before he goes to her house, only to have it melt in his pocket, which of course he sticks his hand inside of and proceeds to smear brown goop all over the bathroom walls.  Her father, played by Bob Saget, becomes infuriated.  So, if you've seen the first one, there's no need to see the second.  Many of the same jokes were used in the second Nutty Professor, much like the sequel to Dumb and Dumber.  And why did it have to be about when Harry and Lloyd met?  Teen movies suck, and Harry and Lloyd's further adventures would've been more interesting.  The only good thing I can think about this movie would be the fact that the actors portraying Daniel's and Carey's characters actually looked like them (had they been 15 years younger).  This movie was kind of a waste of my time, but then again I wasn't doing anything constructive at the time anyway.

This movie can be best described by the words "extremely disappointing". After the hilarious "dumb and dumber" featuring Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels, this can only be described as disastrous!Olsen and Richardson do not fit the characters they play and bring no new characteristics into them. They are only trying to imitate Carrey and Daniels, in which they do not succeed.Where "dumb and dumber" was inventive and hilarious at some points, this was none of the above. The jokes, if there were any, were boring and foreseeable.Carrey and Daniels managed to combine stupidness and humour into the characters, Olsen and Richardson only the stupidness. They just acted like a bunch of total idiots, and that's it.A pity!

reviews.review_title: A major let down - awful script and thoughtless directing
reviews.content: I was a big fan of the original.  I think I laughed more at it's mindless humour than I did at any other movie I can recall.  Admittedly, I was 12 at the time, but have seen it more recently in my adult years and was still highly entertained.So I was looking forward to this.  The trailer promised more of the mindless action provided by the first film and the characters Harry and Lloyd looked well cast.That was where the positives ended really.  As well cast as Harry and Lloyd were - Eric Christian Olsen was excellent and true to Jim Carrey's original portrayl of Lloyd - there is nothing they could do to rescue a diabolical script and storyline.Part of the humour of the first was that only Harry and Lloyd were that ridiculously idiotic.  They were misunderstood by a believable world. This was part of the strength of the first, which allowed for an excellent story line and some near-water inducing situations.  But such clever circumstances are left well behind in this prequel.Everybody is an idiot in this movie and that immediately impacts on the humour potential.  If anything, the poor and corny quips from the supporting cast detract from the movie.  Ms. Heller (Cheri Oteri) comes across as even more stupid than the two main characters.  Such ridiculous but plot-centric concepts as Principal Collins (Eugene Levy) keeping all the evidence of his crimes, needed to bury him in jail for life, baffle the mind for their awful stupidity.  Even the funnier moments wear out quickly - somebody can only think chocolate is poo for so long.Perhaps I'm doing this movie a disservice, but I'm not.  There are a few laughs, however they are few and far between.  The plot is substandard. There are none of the classic settings, for Lloyd and Harry to create carnage in, that were in abundance in the first movie.  The directing is poor and misses many things (like the 90s cars and songs in a movie set in 1986).This calamity of a prequel is no fault of the actors.  Most of the major characters do as well as could be expected with what is just a lame script. Even the end of movie 'girls in need' part is pathetic.This movie was abysmal.  The only reason it gets above a 0 is because Harry and Lloyd were well portrayed and managed to provide an occasional laugh despite the script/director's best attempts.  You'd have to be seriously devoid of comedy in your life to find this movie funny.It just doesn't belong in the same video store as the original. 1/5.

reviews.review_title: Weak follow up to the 1994 hit
reviews.content: A poor dialogue in this prequel.The actors did a good job imitating Jim Carey and Jeff Daniels, but the story itself is really bad.Some laughs but for a limited time. At least the first one had a funny story. I think they shouldn't have done a second movie who ruined the image of the first one.I saw this movie in july 2003 but i had the chance to see it again in 2006 on TV and it was worse from watching it in a movie theater.At least in a theater you cant sleep. I really felt like sleeping because its not enjoyable at all. I gave this a 3 just not to destroy the actors future...Good luck

I was very disappointed by this movie I wanted to leave the theater early because this movie wasn't even funny at all. It had some of the stupidest lines or things that can happen in a movie. I don't even think there was really a plot a mean this movie has bathroom humor that little kids like. It had no heart the actors that played harry and loyod well loyod was good and the person who played harry she take some acting classes. This movie wasn't a hit thank god if it was I'd have nightmares about it for awhile I mean gigli was even better then this I mean gigli I'd give a c- but this I'd give a D- only because the performance of the guy who played loyod was good watch out for that guy you know he might be the next jim carry

Hard to believe this movie fell out of the worst 100. It is by far one of the worst 5 movies I have ever seen. I might argue it is the worst. I didn't make it past 45 minutes. Other movies are equally as bad but at least I made it thru them...this one I could not. IMDb has a problem too many juveniles stuffing the boxes for movies they have not seen. THis movie was in the bottom 100 not that long ago. Believe me it belongs there. So IMDb says I need to write at least 10 line for this review to count. Why was this movie ever made? It was made years after the original and none of the original actors appear here. Totally pointless and all I can say is I am proud I never saw it in the theater or spent a sent to watch it.

Sequels is something that plagues the movie industry, today more than ever. Every successful movie must have a sequel it seems, and sometimes even not-so-successful movies get their share. Next to remakes, lame sequels is one of the worst things i know.Right from the start it's obvious that this movie has absolutely nothing to offer in way of comedy. I read in the trivia that most of the cast were chosen on the grounds that they were "huge Dumb & Dumber fans". I'm not surprised. This movie is simply put what you get if you lock a bunch of talentless retards in a room and loop Dumb & Dumber. We have a duo of "actors" (and i use the term loosely here) acting the parts Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels had in the original. And watching them act is like seeing 10-year old kids in front of a mirror making faces and trying desperately to sound like their idols. Sure i have a laugh with my friends quoting movies, sure i sometimes say "Like a glove!" to myself when i park the car trying to sound like Jim Carrey... Most people do stuff like this. Most people however don't record it on film and try to sell it as a sequel to their favorite movies! Of course the biggest flaw is still not the crappy actors or the complete lack of comedy in both script and acting. Rather it's the complete lack of understanding for what made the first movie such a success. I know a lot of people who loathe silly comedy who still like "Dumb & Dumber". Why? Because the Farrelly brothers have an uncanny sense when it comes to making their oddball characters lovable in a strange way. There is a warmth in the portrayal even when they are at their most pathetic (or even twisted). Of course that is completely missing here, just like everything else that makes a movie good...Even though expectations were abysmally low this movie still managed to put them to shame. I rate this 1/10 since that is the lowest grade it's possible to give.

i couldn't get through the first 20 minutes of it. Its forced comedy with poor punchlines that becomes pure torture to a persons mind. This should have been rated the Worst movie of all time, bar none (including Gigli)!Perhaps if they starred the original cast, maybe it would have brought justice to the whole prequel idea. These two wannabes just try TOO hard to be in their predecessors shoes. But they don't fit in at all.Again, i repeat, AVOID AT ALL COSTS!Good thing i didn't waste much of my time watching this movie neither did i waste my money on it. I'd rather be listening to David Letterman's cheesy musicals than bear another minute of this crap of a movie.WM

reviews.review_title: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
reviews.content: If you are a big fan of the original Farrelly Brothers comedy with the fantastic performances by Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels, then many people were probably questioning why they did not do a sequel with the same stars, and instead opted for a prequel with new ones, from director Troy Miller (Jack Frost). Basically it is 1986, and the moment when teenagers home schooled Harry Dunne (Hostel's Derek Richardson) and Lloyd Christmas (The Hot Chick's Eric Christian Olsen) who is the adopted son of high school janitor Ray (Luis Guzmán), the same high school Harry is being transferred to. They bump into each other, and Lloyd chips his tooth in the process, and they instantly become friends, as if it was destiny, and Harry's mother (Mimi Rogers) said there is a treasure hidden in the school, and he has the map, so this is something they can both aspire to find. Meanwhile Principal Collins (Eugene Levy) is looking for a way to make loads of money in order to get a condo, and seeing the two boys as very stupid and vulnerable he decides to create a fake "special needs" class in order to swindle thousands of dollars. While Harry and Lloyd think this class is for "special people", i.e. will go on to great things, obviously it is the other kind of "special" being referred, and it is their job to get other students to join the class. The students that do accept their place into the "special needs" class are just taking advantage in the fact that they do not have to learn much, including bully Turk (Elden Henson) who they believe to be a best friend, Toby (Josh Braaten) with a broken leg they mistake as a cripple, Toby's girlfriend Terri (Teal Redmann), geeky Lewis (Shia LaBeouf) who constantly changes costumes and they believe is a magical being, Turk's girlfriend and Asian exchange student Cindy aka Ching Chong (Michelle Krusiec), and badly injured football player Carl (William Lee Scott). As time goes by Jessica (Rachel Nichols) realises the Principal might be up to something and that the "special needs" class may in fact be a scam, and Harry and Lloyd have her talking to them, but they just think she is flirting with them with her knowledgeable talk. They do have a fight because of her, but they make up eventually, and decide that they should try and find the "missing treasure", and they mistake a chest containing scam evidence inside it as that treasure. Principal Collins is caught out when at a public President's Day parade, the Special Needs class make a float and the speakers on it play loudly the Principal's confession about the scam, Jessica is found by the pair to have a boyfriend, and the end sees Harry and Lloyd remaining friends, but also approached by the Felcher twins (Julia and Chandra Costello) (remember the first film Harry knew that Lloyd got with Freda Felcher). Also starring Cheri Oteri as Ms. Heller and Bob Saget as Jessica's Dad. Olsen and Richardson do look very similar to the original actors and do a moderately good job being just as stupid as previously seen, if not more so on a less funny scale at times, well, in fact the whole film is less funny it tries pointless to cash in on the teen market, the jokes are sometimes maybe too over the top, and overall it is a prequel hardly worth watching, a silly comedy. It was nominated the Razzies for Worst Screenplay, Worst Screen Couple for Olsen and Richardson and Worst Remake or Sequel. Adequate!

reviews.review_title: The Worst Film Of All Time!!!
reviews.content: Before you consider renting this horrific sequel to the classic movie "Dumb and Dumber", please, by all means, think again.I call this the worst film of all time because, well, it just is. The acting is terrible, the plot is horrendously absurd and predictable, and it is just not uplifting to watch. Probably the absolute worst aspect of this movie is how it tries to be funny. I'm not kidding when I say that Harry and Lloyd produce absolutely no humorous line, joke, or action in this entire film. If there was one god-forsaken reason to watch this movie, it could be either that you are under six years old, enjoy Eugene Levy's acting abilities, or are stoned out of your mind. Other than that, there is no point in viewing this movie, which should have never been made, and should have absolutely no connections to the fabulous "Dumb and Dumber." Please, join my quest in getting this terrible movie back into the bottom 100, where it should achieve its rightful #1 spot some day soon.

reviews.review_title: Well, that wasn't very good now was it?
reviews.content: I loved Dumb and Dumber, I own it, gave it a 10 in the imdb database and have probably watched it 15 times or more.When I first saw the trailer for Dumb and Dumberer, I raised my hands in the air and said "YES!"Unfortunately, after my viewing today, all I could say was "Well, that wasn't very good now was it?"There are so many things wrong with this film, I can't even start to list them, but the one that bugged me the most was probably the way that they took many of the lines from the first movie and tried to incorporate them in the prequel. Usually this incorporation was either wrong or poorly timed. Granted the one good line from the film "Chicks are for fags" is kinda funny, they tried to use it twice, since there were so few other lines that were memorable. Maybe the next best line was Bob Sagget's tirade of "You got poo all over my car" and "You got poo all over my bathroom."As a huge fan of the first film, I am glad I saw this film, but it was so bad that I had to come home and watch the original another time to make up for it.I don't plan on buying this film on DVD, but I will probably watch it again when it comes on cable.If you do need to see this film, see it at the matinee, at least save yourself a few bucks.The best thing about it was Eric Christian Olsen. He did a very good job imitating Jim Carey, and I predict that he has a nice future ahead of him in either films or comedy skits.

Few films live up to their title the way "Dumb and Dumberer" has. Consider this movie to be the god-father of the seven Police Academy movies, four Lepracaun movies, and every other nostalgic movie that had a s***ty sequel. With problems like the original cast being gone, the 1986 setting in the movie being non-existant, and jokes that lead no place you'd swear that most scenes were comprised of auto-biographies about the Director, Troy Miller's real life.After seeing this movie, you'll hate the original even, which makes one wonder why the film ever got past the cutting room floor in the first place. The reason: money. The plot is simple, Harry and Lloyd are in high school and their prinicple has staged a special education class in a scheme to make easy money. From here you're treated to 80 minute of torture that contains more bad jokes than a late night marathon of America's Funniest Home Videos.Not surprisingly, Bob Saget's in the movie. Ironically, Bob says the only funny joke in the movie, comprising of him repeatedly screaming a four letter word that could easily sum up the movie. I'll give you a hint, it rhymes with "hit". Beyond that, every one-liner and gag you see in the movie comes across like a bad "yo-mama" joke. I'm surprised they didn't use the "yo mama so stupid, she returned a donut to the shop cuz it had a hole in it" line.Nothing from the original is incorporated into the prequel, except for a few jokes that Jim Carrey did that his inferior counterpart attempts to redo. As stated earlier, the film takes place in 1986, yet the settings are more bland than a packet of 3 year-old Tang. Worse still, unlike the original movie, the ending is incredibly predictable. Even more odd, why the hell does the school only have about 7 students that are continually shown throughout the film.Watching the movie will sap creative ideas out of you, as we're starting to notice while writing this review. To put it plain and simple, this movie just sucks. We didn't even watch all of the ending.

reviews.review_title: An Apt title; makes the original look like a masterpiece
reviews.content: In the original Dumb and Dumber review, I said that it was a "reason to see comedies".  For me, the original had a special place in my childhood, I've seen in many times since, and I still consider it to be the Farrelly Brothers' best work to date.  Now here is a prequel (the execs probably thought, hey Lucas can do it, how hard can it be) and I think that, if anything else, it is an extremely pale retread/imitation of the original material.  I'm not saying the movie is entirely laughless, in fact there were a few moments when I had a chuckle or two or some grins at the reckless ingenuity of the characters' stupidity (there's even one laugh out loud moment inside the "Special-Needs" classroom involving a quiet jock when he gets riled up by the other students).  The problem lies in that any of the "original" jokes or gags have been done in so many other movies it can only be amusing after a while to the most slight of minds...which means that it will at least earn back a little of the money it took to make it.  In other words, Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd is precisely for it's target group, and it doesn't aim for anything more or audacious like the original, and there's only a minor curiosity to see these two knuckleheads portray younger versions of Carrey and Lloyd.  I didn't hate it, but when I left I wanted at least half of a refund.  D+

reviews.review_title: Not a great movie, but good for a laugh or two
reviews.content: When i first heard that there was going to be another "Dumb and Dumber" movie, i was really excited, but then i heard that Jim Carrey and Jeff Danials would not be returning, so i figured, this ones gonna suck.  So sitting down to watch it i was expecting the worse, but i was delightfully surprised when i found out this movie is actually good. Pretty much all the jokes are funny and there really isn't any sort of lull in the film, like the first one had. The story is simple and the characters are great.  All the performances are really great, especially Eric Christian Olsen and Derek Richardson both a very good and pull off a young Harry and Lloyd very well, i found Richardson to get annoying after a while, but Olsen was dead on the entire movie, he is exactly how Jim Carrey used to be (before he left wacky comedies to do more dramas)This kid could be Carrey's son, and could probably pull off young versions of Ace Ventura and The Mask. I predict you'll be seeing more of Mr. Olsen in the future.  The other actors in the film were also very good, but the one that stood out most was Eugine Levy, Man, is this guy hillarious or what, just seeing him makes me want to laugh, and he's particularly effective as the principal in the film.So basically this isn't the greatest film ever made, but its also not the worst. It does what it sets out to do, which is to provide a few laughs for an hour and a half.  If you loved the first then you should for sure check this one out7/10 stars

reviews.review_title: "This is the suckiest bunch of sucks that ever sucked."
reviews.content: If you liked "Dumb & Dumber," then you will HATE THIS MOVIE!!!  It is horrible!!!  I cannot stress this fact enough.  I have to admit that I giggled a few times, but the script was bad, the characters were bad, and the story line was so bad that at one point I couldn't figure out if there was even a plot.  They try to do some "Dumb & Dumber" call-backs with a few lines, but it all failed.  Don't waste your time, your money, or your disk space for this sad excuse for a comedy.

I saw Dumb and Dumberer on opening night. I entered the theater with a highly skeptical attitude toward this prequel to a classic movie that I love for its total randomness, stupid hilarity and countless other details Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels brought to the part. The movie began with some of the most terrifically horrible ads I've ever seen in my life, and I was losing hope for this movie rapidly if this was how they were going to front the audience before playing it. And then it began...and I was extremely impressed! The actors sincerely looked and acted like teenage versions of they're predecessors, and as such a great on screen team the laughs never subsided when Lloyd and Harry were in the scene.I found only a few faults that would irritate the average movie-goer and criticizer of this movie, as they bugged me ever since I left the theater. One is that Lloyd, Jim Carrey's old part, is very controlling of Harry and is a 'jerk' the majority of the way through the movie, which really got on my nerves. In addition, Harry seemed too laid back and just let Lloyd treat him somewhat negatively. Also, there was almost no plot line! In the first 1994 movie there was an ultimate goal, a reason for the movie. In this prequel, there was one but it seemed as though New Line Cinema Stuck it in there just for spite. Thirdly, they didn't film it in the same way as the first! In Dumb and Dumber, every place the characters went, several funny things happened there that the viewer remembered later as the 'Cafe scene' or the 'beer scene'...In Dumb and DumberER, each clipping was significantly shorter, leaving the audience to figure out later what happened or why something occured, which is, in truth, an insanely poor movie-making technique that irritates.Besides those problems, however, and despite this movie being very different than its well-loved predecessor,it's hilarious! Many parts I found myself not able to breathe from laughing so hard, and maybe you need to be a teenager as I am to fully comprehend the jokes, but it was hilarious in its own way. This is a movie you'll want to take your crew of friends to and laugh at all the sickening stupidity and overall dumbererness of the first adventures, when Harry met Lloyd. I was impressed as it excelled past the standards I set for this flick, and maybe you will think so as well. Give it a try and go see it! An 8 out of 10 stars. Fantastically humorous and, well..dumb!

Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd (2003): Dir: Troy Miller / Cast: Eric Christian Olsen, Derek Richardson, Eugene Levy, Cheri Oteri, Bob Saget: Title is a satire jab at When Harry Met Sally. That film regarded a chance encounter about time and relationships but this idiotic prequel to Dumb and Dumber gives endless vulgarity about stupidity. Lame setup regards Harry and Lloyd taught at home before being sent to high school. The principal plans to extort money and needs a fake special education class to pull it off. Embarrassing climax at a parade with director Troy Miller showing no skill. He previously directed Jack Frost and his talent hasn't improved here. Example of this regards the kidnapped girl who suddenly appears in the conclusion, or the chocolate smeared about the washroom that is mistaken for crap. Can they not smell the difference? This can be credited as a moment in Bob Saget's career that he will likely regret. Eric Christian Olsen and Derek Richardson attempt to fill shoes too big for them. The idea of a narrating regarding their upbringing and first encounter might have worked in hands that didn't belong to Miller. Eugene Levy and Cheri Oteri are wasted as a principal and secretary out to scam their way through life. This film proved to be dumber when you have people who confuse chocolate for sh*t. This film is a perfect example of the latter. Score: 1 / 10

After the huge success of "Dumb & Dumber" (which i liked very much!!)with Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels.. somebody wanted to ride the "wave of money" again and made "Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd"..oh what a mistake!!! This movie is not even near to the hilarious original one. The new actors of the movie are a lame copy of the previous ones, the plot is stupid and most of all not funny at all!!! Why the hell did this movie came out at the first place!!! And why i lost a very important hour and a half of my life on this moronic movie!!!
Some funny parts but mostly terrible and very stupid (3 viewings)

reviews.review_title: Not as good as the first, but still kicked ass!!!!!!!
reviews.content: This is a hilarious comedy. i own the first one and have watched it probably over 50 times now. Its my favorite comedy of all time. I went to see this movie not expecting much because it wasnt the original actors( Carey,Daniels) but i really enjoyed it. Bob saggot did an awesome job and the guy who played Lloyd did a great job following careys role. I give it a 8.7/10 for the great acting and hilarious jokes.

Expectations were high on the sequel of a funny movie, which was the first part. Then there was a bombardment of commercials making me want to see it, better yet: live up to the release date. Then there came the anti-climax of all times. This movie is not funny, not even once. The actors replacing the original cast just don't bring the extra layer which is needed to pull off fart and ***t jokes. Jim Carrey has the talent, he has the rubber face and knows how to use it. The actor replacing him in this prequel doesn't have the skills or the face to pull it off. Next to the poor acting comes the flawed script. Trying to make dumb and dumber into a highscool movie was a very bad move. The principal is an actor who has proven himself in other comedies but this time he can't even act up to the poor script, lame jokes and boring storyline. This movie is a downright shame!

I found the first one not that great, but the gross out humor in it was funny. It was good to see Jim Carrey play someone so stupid. This sequel just beats a dead house to death. It's not funny. The only funny part was the cameo with Bob Saget.  It was gross, but I couldn't help but laugh.  The whole special needs class was kind of insensitive. I guess it was protested against when it was theaters, but I don't remember since it was only in theaters about a week.I was surprised to see Cheri Oteri in this. She was great on SNL, but her movie career has been less than steller.  Her character wasn't that funny in this.And this movie gives the children's game "It" a bad name. The use of "you're it" was so annoying.FINAL VERDICT:  The lack luster box office says it all. It's not worth seeing.

I thought this movie was great and Eric and Derek did great jobs playing the characters. They are both very good looking as well. I hope everyone that sees this enjoys it because its good. And if you dont like it, then you can go away and not say bad things about it. Great job to all of the people who worked on this movie. its my favorite movie at the moment. :-D

reviews.review_title: This movie should be used in torture camps
reviews.content: Oh my God... you know, I wasn't going to write anything because this movie isnt worth my time, but the fact that so many morons are giving it favorable reviews makes me have to stand up for intelligent people everywhere.  This is quite possibly the single worst movie Ive ever seen and I saw Freddy Git Fingered, ok?  This movie actually made me sick.  The lack of any actual humor was astounding.  Apparently the writers assumed that being stupid was funny.  Not so.  In the original movie, the humor came from being able to understand how someone might come to a certain conclusion if said person was increadibly dumb.  This movie, however, has no such logic.  For example, at the beginning of the original, Lloyd asks a girl where she is from, she replys Austria... which does sound a lot like Australia if you're an idiot, so Lloyd proceeds to talk to her making references to Australia... funny. In this latest crap calling itself a sequel, Lloyd passes a man in a car with a British lisence plate and accent.  Lloys yells out, "Watch it Frenchie."  That's not funny, that's just wrong.  Not only did the movie make up it's own horrible jokes, it took perfectly good ones from the original and crapped all over them as well.  The plot was rediculous and there was nothing even remotely intelligent about it.  Say what you will about the characters, but the original Dumb and Dumber was a smart comedy. The only good thing I can say about this movie is the uncanny resemblance the one guy whos name I dont care to look up has to Jim Carrey.  Now, how in the world Miss Essay up there on the home page got a 7.5 from this piece of garbage is beyond me.  There was NOTHING redeeming about this movie and if you think there is then you have no business in a movie theater.  That's not close-minded, its just true.  I could really go on for a while on how bad this movie is, but I won't.  Just avoid it at all costs.  Even if it's free. trust me.

reviews.review_title: Very funny, but doesn't quite match original
reviews.content: And now we know how it all began.No, this doesn't live up to the classic original "Dumb and Dumber", but if you don't set your expectations too high ... it's still not that great. Well, there are plenty of good moments.Derek Richardson and Eric Christian Olsen both do a reasonably good job. So do Eugene Levy and Cheri Oteri. No one's winning awards here but you have to laugh at these people.Rachel Nichols is pleasant and intelligent, and good-looking in the style of Gwyneth Paltrow.Bob Saget is perfectly normal as Jessica's father until ... you know. And then he really shines.Dana Gould has a great scene as the former special needs student.Other enjoyable performances come from Brian Posehn, the store clerk, and Michelle Krusiec as Ching Chong.If you're looking for quality, you're not going to find it here. If you enjoy juvenile humor about losers in high school, this just may be for you.If you love bathroom humor, what happenes after a forgotten chocolate bar is a classic moment.There's another great gag involving frozen drinks, "it", and complete ignorance of exactly how gasoline works. Also an exciting car chase.I know I liked it.

reviews.review_title: I give it a 3/5. Nowhere near as great as its predecessor, but still a decent movie.
reviews.content: First off, I have to say that Dumb and Dumber is one of my all-time favorite films.  I've seen it countless times and it's just as funny as it was the day I first saw it.  That being said, I was delighted to hear that a prequel was going into development in late 2002.  The fact that Carrey and Daniels were not returning was a bit upsetting at first, but the fact that it takes place in 1986 would just make them feel out of place and I was more than willing to give new actors a chance.  After the official trailer, people bashed the flick relentlessly, vowing never to watch it because it looked like pure shit and nothing more.  I, on the hand, couldn't wait until June 13th.I was there opening day, and I have to say this is, hands down, the funniest film I've seen in a long time.  There were a few nods and references to the original, and Derek Richardson and Eric Olsen really perfected the parts of Harry and Lloyd.  Everyone seemed to love the Bob Saget cameo, myself included.  Funny, funny stuff.There were a couple of major problems, however.  First of all, there are anachronistic errors littered throughout, the music being the most distracting.  Artists like Vanilla Ice and Good Charlotte certainly were not around in '86.  Another problem is the editing.  Test audiences weren't big fans of this film, as it was trimmed down from 115 minutes to 82 minutes. Luis Guzman and Mimi Rogers had decent-sized roles, but in the final product their presence was just about wasted.  They even went as far as to delete a musical number and scenes from Lloyd's childhood (i.e. how he eventually came to live with Ray).But, despite being historically incorrect and having major editing issues, the film was still full of laughs and ends up being an enjoyable way to spend an hour and twenty minutes.

This has to be one of the worst comedies i have ever seen. Not only were the jokes unfunny, but the movie was so boring. When I saw that none of the Farrely brothers had directed this, i knew i was in for a disaster, and i was right.The first and best "Dumb and Dumber" got me laughing so hard i pooped a little. Now this movie so good because the acting, the directing, and improvisation. This remains to be the best comedy i have ever seen, next to "Theres something about Mary" I officially hate "Dumb and Dumberer" They should never have remade it, and this director should be shot.Thankyou for reading this.

reviews.review_title: If I've had a worse time, I don't remember when
reviews.content: I am a laughing kind of guy. I laugh at the dentist's office, in the ER, and sometimes I even laugh on the toilet. I went through an eternity of Harry and Lloyd; I think I may have chuckled once. This is a movie that should be lauded in some way as being the ultimate pain that $8 can buy.  I loved the original Dumb & Dumber; I will even say Ace Ventura has its moments. This movie is a soulless, macabre piece of celluloid through which evil incarnates itself. Oh, and I hope everyone involved in its making suffers from horrible cases of: diarrhea, herpes, and possibly gout.

Rhose Island, 1969. Harry Dunne (Derek Richardson)was born. It was so funny when he was about to be born, he bit the doctor. And the doctor said that Harry was a baby who liked to play hide and seek and he was a shy one! Eight years later, Harry had an imaginary friend named Captain Rob and the cops always had to save Rob from from the well in Harry's backyard! Ha! Ha! Ha! And ten years later, Harry's mother (Mimi Rogers) sent Harry and Rob on a treasure hunt. And that was, finding the school! Ha!Ha! Lloyd Christmas (Eric Christian Olsen), on the other hand was an adopted child and his father was a janitor of a school. And they together lived in the school.Lloyed and Harry eventually bumped into each other and Lloyd chipped his tooth when they both went around a corner. Harry was running away from a Rot Veiler and Lloyd, however, was looking for the when in fact, he was living in the school! Lloyd had a bully named Turk (Elden Henson) was sure was a real thug! And Lloyd also met a girl named Jessica Mathika (Rachel Nichols). Lloyd and Harry , however, attended special classes which were in the school's cafeteria and was run by the Lunch Lady, Ms.Heller (Cheri Oteri). And Lloyd and Harry had to find students who were "special" like them.Lloyd first got a boy with casts named Toby (Josh Braaten), Turk, Carl (William Lee Scott), who injured himself in a Football match, an exchange student named Ching Chong (Michelle Krusiec) and a half horse, half human boy named Lewis (Shia LaBoeuf). They were the "Special Needs Class Of 1986".They had a kiff bus. It was so hilarious when Jessica was chasing "The Special Needs Bus" because, she thought it special. And then, the bus went flying into the air in slow motion and inside, everyone was screaming in a decreased tone. And then , when Jessica went flying into the air, she landed with a thud! Ha!Ha!Ha! It was funny when Harry was spending time with Jessica at her house, Harry thought Jessica was making him hot when in fact , it was the heater which he was sitting on which it making him hot! And then, he went to the bathroom and when he removed his hand from his back pocket, and he sniffed his hand due to it being covered in a brown substance. It was chocolate! Mmm! That is something lovely to snack on when you needed to. And when he removed the rest of the chocolate from his back pocket, he threw it up into the air and, it went everywhere! And he wasn't able to clean it up! Lol.I was so charmed when Lloyd was talking to a dog when he was outside Jessica's home. And Harry repeated after him: "Oh, I remember you. How could I forget those hairy nipples?!" And then Jessica's father, Mr.Walter (Bob Saget) entered the room, he asked Jessica why Harry was talking to Jessica like that. And Jessica said, "It's because he's special". Lol! And then! Mr.Walter entered the bathroom and yelled how harry didn't know how to use a toilet when it just chocolate everywhere.Ha!Ha!Ha!It was hysterical to see Jessica take on Harry's mother. It was one of Lloyed's dreams about Harry's mom. And who would fall in love with Lloyd. And suddenly, Harry appeared and Harry was shocked to see it!! Lol! Another amusing moment was when Harry thought he found the treasure which he had been looking for all this time when in fact, it was a chest which belonged to Mr.Collins (Eugene Levy), the Headmaster of the school. Collins' chest had the scams. And soon, all the kids of "The Special Class" realized this was all a scam! So, to get Collins back, the gang created a huge version of Collins in pirate style and it spoke in Collins voice about his "Grand Master Plan". And it sure was the crime of the century! He was trying to make a run off with all the extra money he and Ms.Heller made with that "Special Class". The kids weren't even getting an education!Now, to end this review. I didn't mention all the other laughs in the movie because, they were all clichés and I am sure you would recognize where they got the ending for the movie. But anyways, the film still was fun with style. And you could see that they were even worse when they were kids! Ha!Ha!Ha!

Prequel to the '94 Farelly movie 'Dumb and Dumber', which starred Jeff Daniels and Jim Carrey. In this one, the two nitwits meat each other in High School. The principal at that school (Eugene Levy) has a scheme going on in which he will steal the money the school will get for a 'special class' programme. You kinda guessed who will be the stars of this special class...There's a 'romantic' lovestory as well but it's dumb and stupid more than anything else. Not that I haven't laughed at this movie, or would put it in my bottom 100. But that's about it.4/10.

As others have already said here, perhaps one shouldn't grumble too much at Troy Miller's follow up to the original Dumb And Dumber (1994), as it is precisely what it says on the title. Almost a decade down the line since audiences were first introduced to the stupidities of Lloyd Christmas and Harry Dunne, the new film is sadly without benefit of the original stars Jim Carey and Jeff Daniels - who by this time presumably saw what was coming, and preferred to stick with better things. So Miller took the next best step of making the second installment a prequel, in which we get to see what happens when the loveable lunkheads first met back in 1986.The plot, such as it is, concerns the activities of the corrupt Principal of their High School and his eventual apprehension, partly through the investigative skills of Jessica (Rachel Nichols) a reporter on the school paper, as well as through the blunderings of the dumb duo. In fact the plot barely functions as more than something on which to hang the goonish activities of the two unlikely lads as they discover each other's unique intellectual charms, then meekly compete for the supposed affections of Jessica, and argue with each other. The Principal's current financial scam, intended to secure lucrative funding, is through the establishment of a special needs class of which Lloyd and Harry naturally are founder members. Outside of the gauche romance elements, much of the film is focused on the activities of this class as the various misfits are recruited by our two lads, then end up preparing a float for the procession that climaxes the film.In the hands of the Farrellys, Dumb And Dumberer might have made for an intriguing project, as those auteurs are often able to inject a degree of engagement into the most outrageous scenario. The inclusion here of the 'special needs' class recalls the other directors' humorous but sympathetic treatment of the handicapped. Miller, unfortunately, has none of the Farrellys' abilities to regenerate tired and questionable stereotypes. Despite the likeable gormlessness of Harry (Derek Richardson) and Lloyd (Eric Christian Olsen) in the main roles, his film mostly falls flat, with most of the humour either being too limp or too predictable to make much of an impact.Having said that, there are one or two moments that sparkle amongst the dross. Principal Collins' (Eugene Levy) early appearance, for instance -equipped with a Saddam-type moustache and haircut, the bumbling crook is at one point aptly framed against a poster background of minarets. Such subtle, visual comedy is rare in a film the main highlight of which otherwise is the unexpected lesbian kiss by the delectable Jessica - which, for a brief moment, introduces a sensibility miles away from the childishness of the main action. By the final credits, which feature the increasingly tired scattering of outtakes, one is left with the feeling that these are considerably more 'spontaneous' than the film from which they spring. If nothing else, Dumb And Dumberer sadly proves its own maxim, that "there's nothing more American than doing nothing and getting away with it."

reviews.review_title: What Is This?... Not Worth Seeing
reviews.content: I saw this movie on Friday, and it was as huge waste of money as well as a huge dissapointment. After seeing the trailers, I did not expect this movie to be anywhere near the hilarity of the original, but this was outrightly STUPID. I laughed at one scene, *SPOILER* where Lloyd is dictating to Harry what to say to Jessica, and that was it. Not to say that this is the fault of either Eric Christian Olsen or Derek Richardson, they played their parts well, and also looked extremely similar, but nonetheless no one can recreate the characteristics of Jeff Daniels as Harry Dunne and Jim Carrey as Lloyd Christmas. I would not recommend seeing this movie to anyone. I loved the first one, and some may complain that we are too expectant to see the same quality of film. But why make a sequel when you know its going to be bad? Why did they make this film? The original was just about 2 completely idiotic best friends, and nothing more. This film tried to create a plot, which is impossible with this sort of film.

reviews.review_title: Underrated comedy genius --- or mental dysfunction...
reviews.content: Now, mainstream critics and audiences alike are pathetic at this point in history. Accepting humor and just having a good time is hard with many, especially when some are trying to maintain a grand reputation. This is the case with the overall acceptance of this riotous film. A campy plot and set of jokes couldn't possibly lose a viewer's interest, could it? I mean, people laugh at Family Guy, a show with humor clearly as subjective and ridiculous as that of Dumb and Dumberer. Even Blue Collar humor is more clichéd than this. I admire the entire good mood of this film. I felt great after viewing it. I also haven't laughed that hard in an unnamed amount of time. Don't believe the criticism --- the only reason I can think of for those types of comments is that the lead roles aren't played by the same actors. Yet, who would want to see 40-somethings playing teenagers?

reviews.review_title: This Movie Insults the Intelligence of 1st Graders
reviews.content: This movie was a complete pile of soggy sh*t! After sitting through the first 15 minutes of it I felt like I was back in the 1st grade when fart jokes and toilet humor ruled the day, but sadly this movie didn't even live up to the standards that I held when I was 6 years old. When I left the theater, there was a unanimous vibe coming from the audience that screamed "I can't believe I just wasted 90 f***ing minutes and $8.75 on such a loathsome trash heap of a movie!!!!!!!!" There is absolutely nothing worthy of praise here. I give it a 0/10, which means to avoid it even if a raving lunatic holds a gun to your head and proclaims that the only way to live is to watch this movie.

reviews.review_title: Not a sequel but still has its moments
reviews.content: I don't really disagree with the bad comments except that I don't think it was as bad as people are stating.The original is obviously a different movie because it was original, and even undertaking this movie was a difficult task.Also, they tried to use jokes from the original to tie it in I guess ("i like it a LOTT") but not even one of them worked.The things I did like were the original jokes with the other characters. I did laugh at the mascot guy, and some of the interactions between the characters were original.But again, my expectations were very, very low when I watched it and I also watched it at 4 AM so I might be biased.But I know a horribly unoriginal movie when I see one and they definitely tried to add an original flair to this, which is funny at times.I would say it's about 25% as engaging as the original.

I actually liked this better than the original! I expected it to be awful, but found myself laughing hysterically throughout most of it once it got going. The whole cast was great, especially Mimi Rogers as Harry's mom, though the subplot with Lloyd falling in love with her never went anywhere, and Mimi herself disappears from the film early on, never to return.
Don't believe all the bad reviews; Dumb And Dumberer is a fun film that delivers exactly what it promises: plenty of crude toilet humor and slapstick silliness!

I just saw this movie for free on Film 4 after seeing the title on a Saturday afternoon and with sun in the sky. I thought, ' Hey another Dumb and Dumber film, I'll stay in and watch it!'Well, the fact is the movie is still playing as I write this and I never turn off from a movie. I studied film studies at college, and if a film gets bad I think about how they filmed it while still watching it.To be blunt, I can't even do that with this movie.1 star... read the other reviews. The 5 star one was obviously fake and planted. Take note of every review on here except that one, avoid this movie. Do not even mention this movie to friends because they will out cast you because of it.Unfunny, uninspired and UN worthy of even watching once!

First off, I would like to say that I am not a tough critic of movies. With that said, this was possibly the worst movie I have ever seen in my life. I laughed at two scenes, and that is it.  The theater was dead throughout the entire movie, and I was anticipating the end of the movie the entire time, since I had a hard time leaving after I paid $9 for this piece of crap. If you want a good idea of how bad this movie is, think of it as the Star Wars prequels.  Dumb and Dumber was one of the funniest movies ever, and like Phantom Menace, Dumb and Dumberer came out and sucked so much.  For the love of God do not make the same mistake I did and see it, its like supporting Comedy-fraud.

reviews.review_title: Perhaps the Worst Comedy Ever Made
reviews.content: I can't even begin to describe how bad this movie was.  I will admit there were a couple of times I laughed, but they took those jokes, and kept using them over and over.  For example:  The Bob Sagat feces scene, and the "curtains match the carpet" type jokes.  The dialogue was so childish, mindless and not even stupid funny.  I cringed in my seat watching it.  I thought maybe the guy who played Lloyd, who was the "cocky blonde guy" in Not Another Teen Movie (which he was funny in), would possibly make the movie a little funnier than it looked to be, I was dead wrong.  Don't even bother seeing it, just go rent the original Dumb and Dumber again, and get some guaranteed laughs.  This one even surpasses Spice World in the running for worst comedy ever.  I give it 1/10 stars.

I saw the movie in theatres i liked but it was not as good as the first one maybe the reason is for everyone is that Jim carrey and Jeff Daniels were not in it. but other than that it was good also it was not as funny as the first one. Also the actors that are in it are not very good but the story line is good the script is really good the way harry and Lloyd meet is very funny but my only wish was when i heard of this movie was that Jim carrey and Jeff Daniels would be in it but to bad it was still good but not the best in my opinion if Jim carrey and Jeff Daniels were in it it would have been much more funnier. Also i heard that Jim carrey said he hoped it failed at the box office and it did. see Jim carrey don't do sequels any more sense ace Ventura when nature calls i don't know why but he don't.It is not the best but it is OK.

Now this.. this is a load of garbage. The first Dumb and Dumber had me laughing so much, but this, I only got a few laughs out of this. I have to admit it was a pretty funny movie, at parts, but compared to the first movie, this was nothing. I'm surprised they decided to go and make this movie with out Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels. I never even heard of the actors who played Harry and Lloyd! The thing that irritated me the most was Euguene Levy. The whole movie turned into a drama after he was in it and took away from the whole point of the cartoonish comedy in the movie. He ruined the movie. This movie was nothing compared to the first. They should have not made this movie. And Dumb and Dumber To is coming out this year, and they aren't even counting this movie as the second! That's how bad it was. At least Dumb and Dumber To has the old actors in it and the same characters. Plus it is going to be a cross-country road trip. There is really no point in this movie. 3/10 because of how horrible this was compared to the first.
I don't know what it is about this movie but but I love it so much. There is some dumb parts for sure but they are still funny as heck.

Being a huge Dumb and Dumber fan, I checked this movie out anticipating mediocraty. It met my expectations alright. The movie is not the same without Carrey, Daniels and Farrelley Bros. D'uh, we knew that. But what makes the movie even worse is the writing. It was one of the most poorly written, thrown together for profit piece of trash ever. The jokes were recycled, the acting left much desired for(with the exception of Richardson), and even Eugene Levy's part wasn't funny. Levy is a great actor who can be very funny and this movie didn't utilize his talent at all. They made the characters appear to be retarded instead of just dumb (what's so funny about that!?), they made Lloyd come off gay which he wasn't in the original. Lloyd's dad was ridiculous and not in the good way.To make up for jokes, talent and creativity, they inserted music montages throughout using footage you JUST saw 5-10 min earlier. This movie has nothing to do with Dumb and Dumber. It's completely terrible and not worth seeing. I'm angry that they tried to franchise the coolest movie ever into this rubbish. Thumbs down.

reviews.review_title: Funniest movie I've seen in years
reviews.content: These guys are crazy. There's also a couple more movies in this series starring Jim Carey. I'm going to watch those also

I agree with most reviews that this movie was far from anything great. The script needed a re-write, possibly help from the Farrelly Brothers could have helped. This movie had nothing to do with the creators of Dumb and Dumber, Bobby and Peter Farrelly. Besides having their names in the credits, the movie had nothing to do with the funny filmmakers. If they did, the film could have been saved. Unlike the story, the acting in the film is very good. Eric Olsen and Derek Richardson do the impossible. They have to act stupid, funny, and also portray the characters of Harry and Lloyd. They do an amazing job portraying younger versions of Jeff Daniels and Jim Carrey's characters from the original 1993 comedy. With a better script, the movie could have done much better.

reviews.review_title: There is a difference between dumb and very stupid.
reviews.content: Bad, and tasteless comedy that makes Jim Carry look like a comic genius in comparison, and makes the Farrelly. brothers look like prestige directors of tast. Every thing that can go wrong with this film goes wrong, and it's not even funny. Keep a way and rent the original.

Went in not expecting much and got even less........Almost feel ashamed to say I sat thru the whole thing.The writers of this film should write the makers of the original A letter of apology.Come to think of it the same letter should be stapled to the exit doors of the theater.

Oh man I have never laughed so hard in my life! That movie was the GREATEST! I couldn't stop kicking the chair in front of me, thank god there was no one in it! I began to tear! Both actors chosen for Harry and Lloyd did fantastic jobs and I don't think any other cast could've been better!

Dumb and Dumberer is the prequel to the original smash hit with Jim Carey, The second stars Derek Richardson and Eric Olsen with Eugene Levy playing a very entertaining role.Dumb and Dumberer was just not the right film to make after the first one which was just funny and well done. The second was beyond stupid it was very comic but just not believable of the stupidity, lacking in storyline besides the fact they meet in high school nothing else occurs in the film its a big nothing flat film, that probably would have been better off left.Its worth a 3 because of the comedy, but the storyline and predictability and originality leaves a lot to be said, or in this case little.

reviews.review_title: Far and Away the Worst Movie I've Seen
reviews.content: This had to be the worst film that had a decent budget to have been ever made. There was no humor that was even remotely intelligent and anything that could have been construed as funny was stolen from the original film which I actually enjoyed very much. Eugene Levy definitely has redeeming qualities that can prop up a bad comedy into respectability, but this one is just too bad to comprehend. The acting is terrible save Levy and the kid who plays Lloyd because he at least studied how Jim Carey's Lloyd behaved in "Dumb and Dumber". The plot is shallow, dim-witted and lacks even a slap-stick appeal. There is no reason anyone should ever see this movie for any reason.

A friend of mine recommended this film as a movie you could "sit and casually laugh at"...whatever that means. So i rented this hunk of goo expecting something along the lines of Hots Shots! or Mafia! or any of the other moderately funny lipstick's. wow..... The only seen i recall getting an honest hard laugh was when Harry was sitting in his house and a large cinder block crashes through his 2nd story window with a note that said "Harry, I'm outside". That was funny, and i think it was the only good laugh for me in the whole film. Considering i didn't make it all the way to the end, I assume that the last thirty or forty minutes didn't save the film. It had a dreadful soundtrack, the acting was very....eh, and the....well, it just wasn't good. period.

This was the worst movies I have ever seen ( Close first to Napoleon Dynamite)! It was a disgrace to Dumb and Dumber (My personal favorite movie of all time). It was the biggest waste of 2 hours (That felt like 10) and the money I spent to go see it! Do Not Go Rent Dumb And Dumberer you will be sadly disappointed if you have any remote taste in movies! The reasons that I dislike/hate this movie is that it has no comedic value. All it does is make Hary and Loyd seem like retards. They take everything that could be funny and ruin it by making it seem completely stupid. The One and only One funny part in this movie is seeing Bob Saget yell S*** a lot. but seriously they even made that unfunny by doing t too many times.

This film had too be one of the most unnecessary, pointless(and plot less for that matter)films I have ever seen.With the other Dumb and Dumber being so successful I thought I would go along to see what this one was like.I was so disappointed. It has no plot and basically drags on for a while.I did not even laugh once but crindged at the cheesy jokes and cliché phrases. I could have made a better movie myself. Some parts were mildly amusing like the polar bear suit and the woman suit.I found the end totally off the point but Eugene levy did play Pricipal Collins quite well even though at some points his acting was quite wooden.A good enough shot but wouldn't buy it on DVD * 3 / 1 0

reviews.review_title: Very BAD Movie and nothing like the first one!!!
reviews.content: This movie is so bad that the only thing good about it is that you can use it as a Frisbee! NOTHING like the first one, the actors are TERRIBLE (and resemble something totally different from the first) and everything about the movie was bad. Who made this movie 10 year olds? The plot is all over the place once Harry and Lloyd are doing something one minute and another minute they are doing something totally different. And when I was watching the movie I did not conceive what the conflict was about throughout the whole film! This whole movie was a total waste of electricity watching it! Once you have made a very funny and original movie, don't make another one.

What an odd movie. Seriously. Though some of the humor does tend to get odd and beyond strange at times. It still can be funny in some parts. It probably would have been much easier to just make a straight sequel to the first movie. i would have much rather seen that then this movie.The movie does not really seem to be about Harry meeting Lloyd at all. Though the first few minutes are, it quickly moves away from this to involve a plot with a corrupt principle(?) It tends to get very strange at times. Harry and Lloyd just really get in the way of the plot and you begin to want them to leave any of the scenes they are in. Onto the characters of Harry and Lloyd. The actors do an alright job trying to be Jeff Daniels and Jim Carrey. Sometimes a little bit too hard to be them.The plot is nothing new, and neither is the movie. But it does tend to have it's moments of over-the-top stupidity, that you just can't help but laugh. But some of the scenes also tend to grow annoying and create the feeling of wanting them to end....Quickly. When the final credits rolled, I was left feeling a little cheated. Not too much is really told about how Lloyd grew to want to hit on girls so much. He seems to really dislike them in this movie. Go figure.I wouldn't really recommend this movie to fans of the first movie, because nothing new is really brought to the table on the characters. I will, however, recommend the first Dumb & Dumber. One of my all time favorite funny movies. I think this was the first farrely brother's movie. And it is really funny. In this movie it just feels that they might have wanted to top the farrely brother's job with the first movie, and it slowly goes flat.Just skip this one unless you want a couple of laughs. If you want your full money's worth, rent the first one.

First, I absolutely cannot stand prequels. Hate 'em with a passion. But I rented this one because I liked the first movie so much, and I actually liked this one just as much. Those guys really put in a serious effort to be enough like the original Harry & Lloyd (Carrey and Bridges), but not so much like them that it went over like a movie full of impressions. Face it: we don't watch a movie called "Dumb and Dumber(er)" for the intellectual conversation; it's silly, stupid comedy and it works very well. Don't knock these guys or this movie until you've seen it, then make a decision.

I enjoy watching Dumb and Dumber. One day we were at our local preplayed, a movie store in our town, and I decided to look for Dumb and Dumber, since we already had the second. I didn't find it, but I did find this. My first thought was, "meh, worth a shot". My dad bought it and we watched it. It was nowhere near as good as either of the official dumb and dumber movies. The only scene I ever laughed at really hard was the bathroom scene. Seeing the dudes reaction to the chocolate all over the bathroom killed me. I remember rolling on the floor in tears. If you are a huge fan of the 1994 move, than this probably isn't going to be for you. But if you do like immature comedy, give it a try.

This movie took established characters, fleshed out a backstory, and added to the mythos. Everyone in the movie gives %100 and is fully onboard with the craziness. Is Olsen Jim Carrey? Of course not. But he delivers a phenomenal performance. The cast is enormous, and again. they are all in. This movie did what it set out to do.

reviews.review_title: Warning:Watching this movie can be injurious to ur health
reviews.content: This movie is most likely to sweep Razzie awards this year.While the orginal Dumb and Dumber was a treat,this movie is ridiculous.The movie is full of pathetic jokes.The movie is based on bunch of losers called Harry and Lloyd who look nothing like Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels (who starred in the original movie ).The movie is particularly irritating because of its cast of B-grade regulars and poor direction.The story revolves around a loony principal and his bunch of empty headed students.My rating 1\10 (just for director"s respect!).

reviews.review_title: An unbelievably poor attempt to follow a classic
reviews.content: While "Dumb and Dumber" sits atop my all-time movie list, its sequel finds its way to the bottom. Eugene Levy couldn't even save this horrendous movie. The acting was about the quality of modern soap operas, and the script was just pitiful. I felt I would be wasting my time as I entered the theatre to watch it, but I left in utter disbelief. The only part that made me laugh was when Bob Saget saw all the chocolate in the bathroom and later on his car. Apart from this, the film sickened me, and it saddened me that the 1994 comedy classic will be forced to be paired with its unjust sequel. The only thing this movie accomplished was that it made me appreciate "Dumb and Dumber" a whole lot more. That was a masterpiece. "Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd"...well, that was a piece of something else.

I dk why so many bad reviewS?? I usually do not do reviews but after seeing the rating i feel like i want to give this movie props. It is one of the funnier movies ive ever seen. It Definetley top 50 all time comedies for me. The actors do a marvelous job acting like harry and Lloyd. The 2 actors do such a great job acting like jim carrey(Lloyd) and jeff daniels (Harry) and impersonating lloyd n harry from the 1st dumb and dumber. I think it's hilarious. A cult classic to me, especially if you like the dumb n dumber movieS. I encourage you to watch n choose for yourself. This movie also has a great soundtrack in my mind. Great film all around!! You gotaa remember that is harry and lloyd. Their character's are kind dumb lol.... Actors act/ portray themselves just like jeff daniels and jim carrey. Priceless classic!!

The actors playing Harry and Lloyd gave it a good effort but the script, other acting talent and plot were diabolical.  84 minutes of my life has passed, 82 minutes of it in mispent optimism, don't repeat my mistake ... apart from Mimi Rogers' french kiss!

If you're about to watch a prequel of "Dumb and Dumber", well, you sure know what you're about to see: an idiot and a retarded doing and saying things typical of an idiot and a retarded. In some sequences you'll wet your pants, and in some others you won't. That's it.Those ones which are looking for intelligent humor, please just keep your distance. Those who wanna have a funny time "When Harry meet Lloyd" ain't that bad. It's quite remarkable the work of the guys in the casting section, for they've found an actor that REALLY looks (and behaves) like Jim Carrrey with 20 years less.*My rate: 5/10

reviews.review_title: Pretty crap except for one or two scenes
reviews.content: This was always going to be fatally flawed, because imitation is never going to be able to capture the crazy guy that Jim Carrey is. Whether or not you are a fan of his, you have to admit he is one of a kind, with such energy and personality. So while these kids do a pretty good job of acting like Harry and Loydd, they just aren't as fresh or funny. Though thats not to say the first movie was all that funny itself.I would leave this out of the bottom 100, it was not so bad that I wanted to hunt down members of the cast, kidnap them and force them to watch Glitter or any movie with a 'singer come actress' in it, and I was able to laugh at two things. One was the half-sized bus (I have a thing about oddly-sized objects, I don't know I just am amused by that sort of thing, big doors or over-sized glasses) and the other was the scene in which Loydd talks about Harry's mum and being his step dad. It's the only dialogue I thought was funny.
