"Don't talk back to me like that young man".Yeah but all in all, I would not recommend seeing this movie, unless you really enjoyed the kind of humor in the first one, or you're really desperate. Or drunk. That helps. It makes everything funny.

I cannot believe I paid what I paid to see this movie! I feel dumb and dumberer after watching it.  If it wasn't for the beautiful Rachel Nichols I think I would have walked out.  This girl could be good if she had someone ACTING with her in the movie... unlike Dumb and Dumberer.  This movie rates up there as one of the stupidest movies I have seen in my life. DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME!  GO SEE SOMETHING ELSE!

I rarely swear in a movie review. If I dislike a certain feature, I always try to describe it as 'disappointing' or 'only mildly enjoyable'. Unfortunately, there's only one word in the English language that could possibly sum up DUMB AND DUMBERER - and it rhymes with kite.Plotwise, and that's a laughable word to use here, D&D tells the story of how dumbass friends Harry and Lloyd came to meet at high school. Forget the original's gutsy charm; this is a teen gross-out movie along the lines of "American Pie" - but as the two main protaganists have the mental age of a five year old (between them) - their goals aren't to lose their virginity or anything adult like that, simply to recruit people to be in their special needs class.Sound fun? I especially like the way that director Troy Miller decided to make Harry and Lloyd unlikeable dur-durs, thereby removing the only possible remaining interest for the audience. In the original, Harry and Lloyd were funny - braindead, for sure, but funny. You wanted to see them succeed in their wholly unattainable goals; here, you're waiting for something bad to happen just to get them off the screen for a few precious minutes.The only positive thing about this movie - and it's a very small positive, nowhere near enough to actually go see it - is Eugene Levy as the school's scheming headmaster. Eugene is one of the funniest actors in America at the moment and it's sad to see him in drivel like this. Were it not for his presence, I'd definitely have walked out the cinema mid-movie.Avoid this, it's the worst movie of the year. * / *****

reviews.review_title: One of the dumberest movie's I've seen in a while
reviews.content: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd is a prequel to the Jim Carrey/Jeff Daniels comedy Dumb and Dumber, but it lacks all the heart of it. In Dumb and Dumber, the characters were so dumb that it was funny, but in this one not only the characters, but the actual movie is so dumb that it's just....dumb. It uses some of the same gags but it's overall style is what makes it so bad. It seems more like a gross-out teen comedy than a buddy comedy. Even some hardcore fans of Dumb and Dumber will probably not like this. The plot is stupid, and there aren't enough funny parts to save it. I do give those two guys credit for doing such a good job in filling Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels' shoes, though. Their Harry and Lloyd impressions are almost perfect. Other than that, and maybe one or two funny parts, this movie blows.My rating: 1/10

This sorry Excuse as a movie gets 2 stars for just getting funding to be made. Studio should've invested the money to help real children with special learning disability instead of wasting money on wasting the moviegoers' time and money.

reviews.review_title: clear your mind first of your expectations
reviews.content: Considering this is a prequel to one of the most popular cult classics of the 90s, something like this is going to get back-lashed.First off, to all the critics, please stop calling this film a piece of crap. It may look like crap, but seriously people, I think Dumb And Dumberer is a great idea.Didn't see this in the theater, but saw the trailer plenty of times to get me interested in the idea. The trailer alone was really funny, and reminded me that every once in a long while, there has to be a movie that has to be this ridiculous to laugh at. With that said, I honestly think that the sequel coming out later this year will hopefully resonate well with the fans.Slap yourself a few times over, then sit down and see what you think of this movie when you put it in next, or when it shows up on TV.The female lead will be at the Seattle Comic-Con this year, (2014) and will hopefully meet her.It may not live up to the original, but they used plenty of original material to give you an idea of how dumb Harry and Lloyd really are.(Loved the idea of Harry's invisible captain friend! Seeing the car hit that wooden wagon was pretty priceless!!)

It literally hurt me to watch this movie.  The hour and a half in the theater felt like at least twice that, and I have never moved around in my seat so much.  The only reason I had any hope for this movie was the fact that it featured Eugene Levy and Luis Guzman.  Big mistake for these talented actors to waste their talents in this film.  It was boring and simply unfunny.The reason the first one was funny was because we actually believed that these guys could be as dim as to do the things they did.  But in this film, with lines like "My name's Lloyd Christmas"..."You're Santa's kid?" it just seems like some people pretending to be dumb.  And putting them in a special ed class makes it something not so funny anymore.  If you watch the way they act, you can imagine that they really would need to be in a special ed class.The material from the original movie rehashed in this one is forced and not funny.  When you hear lines like "Just when I thought I couldn't get any madder at you, you go and do something like this.." you know what's coming. And that takes a lot of humor out of it.I forced a single laugh, during Bob Saget's scene (which grew old at light speed).  What people don't realize is that Bob Saget's career has turned into showing up in movies to say something crude, just because he was the dad in Full House.  It's outgrown any humor, and the scene itself (there's sh!t all over the bathroom!) displays every forced thing in this movie.I was relieved when the credits ran.  When I looked over to my friend to see her reaction, she was doing what I wish I had been the entire movie: sleeping.

This movie is not as awful as everyone says it is. This was a great movie. It is a stupid movie, but it is supposed to be,hence the name dumb and dumber. Everyone says that it would have been better with Jim Carey and Jeff Daniel's, but I disagree. The two actors who played their role were amazing to me. The plot was stupid, but i thought it was funny anyway. I don't care how many stars this movie has or how much money it made in the box-office. This was one of the funniest movies have ever seen and one of the best. It is not the dumb movie everyone says it is. I loved this movie and i recommend it to anyone who loves comedy. This movie is awesome!

Dumb and Dumberer (2003) * 1/2 (out of 4) In 1994 the Farrelly Brothers (Peter and Bobby) kicked down the door with their first film Dumb and Dumber, which came out of nowhere and became a surprise hit at the box office. Starring Jim Carrey as Lloyd Christmas and Jeff Daniels as Harry Dunne the film took these two friends and threw them into a wild adventure full of gross and outrageous humor. The director's would continue this style of humor in upcoming films such as Kingpin and There's Something About Mary. Considering Dumb and Dumber was such a hit it was natural for a sequel to follow. Nine years later fans got Dumb and Dumberer but without the same cast and director's you pretty much know what to expect.The film takes place in 1985 as Harry (Derek Richardson) is about to attend high school, which will be his first time in a public school. Harry was the product of home school by his mother but she feels it's time for her son to get out into the real world and make friends. On his way to school the dumb Harry gets lost and eventually bumps into the dumber Lloyd (Eric Christian Olsen) who is also lost. The two join forces and head to school to take things over but of course the dumb duo are the laughing stock of the school.Inside the school Principle Collins (Eugene Levy) has his own plans for the new year. A rich guy is offering every school one hundred thousand dollars if they create a class for the mentally challenged. Collins along with his girlfriend plans to create a fake class so that they can steal the money and head to the beach. The only way to get their fraud going is to find a couple dumb students to recruit over dumb students for this class. Of course this challenge falls into the laps of Harry and Lloyd and they do their best to gather other dumb students. However, the beautiful school reporter Jessica Matthews (Rachel Nichols) seems to know something is wrong with this class so she begins to investigate and befriends the two dumb friends who happen to fall in love with her.I have to be honest and say I was pretty disappointed when Dumb and Dumberer showed up by FedEx because I really didn't want to see the thing after hearing so many bad reviews. Every film critic seemed to give the film no higher than one star and the film is in the bottom one hundred at the IMDb. I went into the film expecting something truly horrible and that's pretty much what I got but there are a few funny scenes and one extremely funny scene that makes me want to tell people they should check the film out. I certainly wouldn't spend over two dollars on the movie but if you get the chance to view it for free go ahead and give it a shot.I'll start with all the badness in the film. For starters, I was dying for a sequel to the original film but this certainly isn't what I wanted. I really hate when characters are brought back and none of the original stars are playing the original roles. I know this is a prequel but I'm guessing this was made over a sequel because either Carrey or Daniels weren't interested in another film. Any sequel or prequel should have been put on the shelf since neither of them were involved but what we have here is a poor excuse to milk money from the fans of the original film. Looking at the box office totals apparently fans didn't fall for this movie so good for them.The biggest problem is the film is trying way too hard to be funny. You can tell the actors are over doing everything from their lines to their facial expressions trying to make us laugh but the screenplay resorts to jokes from the first film and they simply don't work here. Another problem is the incredibly annoying lead actors who really don't add anything to the roles. I know they are playing younger versions of Carrey and Daniels but instead of acting like them, the new actors simply mock them and try to follow in their footsteps. Again, perhaps this is to be expected but all it does in the end is make us feel sad that Carrey and Daniels aren't here.The majority of the jokes are very stupid and don't get any chuckles let alone laughs. We get stupid fart jokes and stupid jokes about one friend's mother hitting on the other. As I mentioned earlier there are some funny scenes and one hilarious scene that centers around Harry and his so-called date with Jessica at her house. Harry is expecting to lose his virginity and this here leads to some very big laughs. There's some toilet humor in the bathroom, which had me laughing harder than any recent film I can recall. This scene here would make me tell you to check the film out on television. Bob Saget has a few good scenes but poor Eugene Levy is pretty much wasted throughout the film. Dumb and Dumberer is a pretty bad movie but the date scene is worth a Cinemax viewing.

This is my all time favorite movie! I can't see how it can be in the bottom one-hundred. I guess you have to have a little thing called sarcasm to understand and enjoy it. Dumb and Dumberer is funny on so many levels. Not only can it make a sad person laugh, but it has sarcasm and wit as well as potty humour. I pity people who do not like this movie. If you have not seen this movie you MUST go see it as soon as you can. Call the local BlockBuster or whatever you go to rent your movies and ask them if they have it in stock. You must rent it. Dumb and Dumberer is one piece of work I must say. If you don't like it you have NO sense of humour.

This is by far one of the funniest movies I have ever seen in my entire life. It is so funny and there are little parts that if you pay attention you will laugh so hard. Especially look at the body language. That is one of the funniest parts of this movie. I recommend it.
This movie isn't so bad. Its very entertaining. But most of all, Eric Christian Olsen plays Lloyd perfectly and his performance alone is worth the watch.

reviews.review_title: Utter bilge but better than the first
reviews.content: From the trailers, it would appear as though this movie was better than the first. It was but it was also a complete pile of crap as expected from such an undertaking. With terrible acting, no story, horrible jokes, toilet humor and utterly disgusting events, this movie is something that should have priority on everyone's avoid list. The two guys playing with each other like children is not funny nor cute nor dumb. They look more like gay lovers by the way it is crudely portrayed in this movie. This movie should be in the bottom 100 and I don't know why its not? Easily one of the worst movies ever made. Don't fall for the commercials and torture yourself by seeing this movie. Avoid at all costs.

When I saw the first trailer for this movie I thought to myself, "No way, if Jim Carrey ain't in it, what's the point? It's just some crappy movie the studios are trying to get money for. It'll suck." And I'm sure most people will tell me I was right. And okay, it was some crappy movie the studios were trying to cash in on BUT, it most definitely did NOT suck. In fact, it rocked! If you want to see this movie because you loved the first one, you probably will hate it. You'll probably say it lost all the appealing features of the first one and just kept the dirty "potty humour". And I won't argue with you. But, if like me, you can look at this film, not as a prequel to a great movie, but as just a movie, you should find it has a certain charm.Eric Christian Olsen made a complete transformation for this movie (its hard to believe, but he's the "cocky blonde guy" from Not Another Teen Movie"). He did as good a job, if not better, than Jim Carrey could have done himself. It's a worthwhile movie, just to see ECO play this character so well. And then there's Bob Saget. Everyone knows him as the dad in almost every cute kids TV show, so to hear him swear like that...well that's worth the price of rental at least! Anyway, this movie isn't going to make you think, or do anything more than make you glad you have a better IQ that Harry and Lloyd, but it is one of those movies that is so funny and simple that I, at least, want to watch it over and over again. Give it a chance, keep an open mind, forget about the original. It might not be a good "prequel", but it is a great movie. In my humble opinion, at least. :-)

I put off watching this because I thought the first one was a dud. I couldn't stop laughing throughout this movie. It is non-stop slapstick and sophomoric, and that's what makes it great. No pretense at anything here. The chocolate bar in the back pocket and the bathroom scene were a riot. I noticed a lot of negative comments, I guess its not a film for everyone. I'm not very sophisticated I guess, but no apologies.I want to buy it and have it around for a good laugh. I also liked the music. The relationship between the principle and the special ed teacher was great. It's just a matter of time until the political correctness crowd will ban films like this because dumb people should be respected too, until then these dummies were are funny.

reviews.review_title: Dumb is being nice to this film....
reviews.content: It's the 1980s. Lloyd Christmas and Harry Dunne are seen by many as 'special', and become best friends as soon as they meet. Principal Collins and his lover, lunch lady Ms. Heller, want to make as much money out of scams, and their next idea is to create a special needs class. Ms. Heller is the teacher, and they have assigned Harry and Lloyd to round the special students up. School News Reporter Jessica is suspicious though, and desperately tries to find out the truth, even if it means gaining Harry and Lloyd's help.....The original was an exceptional comedy, one that really paved the way in comedy for almost a decade. Before that, we were bombarded with spoofs with a varying degree of quality.Ten years on from the original, we have this worthless piece, which is nothing more than to milk as much money from kids who saw the original at home. What we have here is two actors doing impressions of the actors, rather than the charachters, and recycling jokes from the original, so people will think of that film and maybe get confused into thinking that this is any good.It's pretty awkward to watch at times, especially when we have decent actors such as Guzman, Rogers, and Levy actually trying their hardest to put in a decent performance.Maybe as a T.V series, this could have worked, but no, the makers knew what they were doing, they knew that the original was and still is a cult comedy, and people were going to fall for it.

It's a shame you can't give negative ratings on imdb, because then this awful piece of crap "movie" would get a minus 10 from me.This is possibly the worst movie ever made in the history of man.The "actors" are so horrendous it's laughable. I realized that one of these shooting stars is also a main lead in the abomination of a movie "Hostel".Really makes you wonder who hires these bozos? Or who poures in millions of dollar into these projects?Do not, I repeat do NOT watch this movie! Ever!

reviews.review_title: American Public School:That's the way not to be dumb
reviews.content: STAR RATING:*****Unmissable****Very Good***Okay**You Could Go Out For A Meal Instead*Avoid At All CostsDumb and Dumberer marks a turning point in this current swelling up in the creative juices of Hollywood's script writing department.We have an idea that has obviously just been thought up as something to fill the time,that,has,inadvertently,emerged as something that is,in it's own way,pretty interesting and inspired after all,despite the producers almost certainly not meaning it to be.A sequel to 1994's original Dumb and Dumber,that takes place BEFORE Harry and Lloyd (in the original film played by Jeff Daniels and Jim Carrey,here by Eric Christian Olsen and Derek Richardson) grew up to become losers,detailing their high school years,where,they realised that they were,well,dumb.Such is the state of things in this modern filmic world.Where will we go from here?There seems to be a running joke at the beginning of the film that the reason Harry and Lloyd started out so dumb in life was because their parents taught them at home,rather than sending them to public school.The 'get an education' slogan is quite obviously being plugged here,in a fairly cynical way at the film's target audience.No,it didn't go unnoticed.As for the film itself,there are one or two riotously funny moments,but these are,unfortunately,on the balancing end of the scales,with some tired and easily predictable gags unfortunately on the tipping end.Plus the film does drag on a bit to the end,but there's the gorgeous Rachel Nichols to distract us from the otherwise generally pretty gross proceedings going on and when the funny moments do happen,the sh*t really does hit the fan.Quite literally,in fact,in the final scene (or so it would seem).**

reviews.review_title: I can't lie... I just watched this and laughed alot
reviews.content: Make no mistake, this is no masterpiece of comedy, its not even really a great movie but it is a funny dumb comedy. I put it off for almost 20 years because I just couldnt bring myself to watch it, and I think giving it years of space benefitted it for me. The two leads did their jobs well, especially Lloyd Christmas and the gags genuinely made me laugh (the Cyrano bit with the chocolate bar was really funny). Even some of the side characters were good (Bob Saget, Cheri Oteri, Shia Labeouf, Eugene Levy). Watch it if you want to give it a chance. If you're attached to the original in a blindly loyal way do not bother.
It's not that bad but it's not good. It's this movie that you watch, you didn't feel anything at all, no happy,no laugh, just nothing. It was going in straight line and finished.

It is amazing some of the things coming out of Hollywood these days. "Dumb and Dumberer" is a film that almost leaves me speechless. It is so bad and so utterly pathetic that you will find yourself laughing at how terrible this waste is. This is of course the much awaited second installment (a prequel) to the surprise hit of 1994 that put Jim Carrey on the map more than any other film he had done before. I enjoyed that first movie very much because it had a cleverness to its insanity (that was due to the Farrelly Brothers). There was intelligence and a bit of emotion to that production. Nothing remains here though as Eric Christian Olsen (Jim Carrey originally) and Derek Richardson (Jeff Daniels originally) do indeed meet as they start their final year of high school in 1986. Richardson has been home-schooled by a loving, but somewhat dim-witted mother (Mimi Rogers) and Olsen lives within the school with his janitor father (the usually dependable Luis Guzman). They do crash into each other literally just as evil principal Eugene Levy comes up with a scheme to steal $100,000 that will be donated to the school for students with special needs. Thus he and lunch-lady/lover Cheri Oteri (of "Saturday Night Live" fame) bring the titled pair together and develop a class of morons and lazy pupils. Naturally the typical insanity takes place with humor that might accidentally entertain youngsters with its tasteless brand of toilet jokes. Just an ugly mess that drops the American cinema down a few more painful pegs. Turkey (0 stars out of 5).

reviews.review_title: Why Does Everyone Hate This So Much?
reviews.content: Before the events in Dumb & Dumber, before they move on, before they grow up (very slowly)...there was high school.Basically it's Eric Christian Olsen taking over for Jim Carrey and Derek Richardson taking over for Jeff Daniels. It wasn't as long as Dumb & Dumber, but that can be overlooked, especially knowing that comedy movies are all spanned around 75-90 minutes with about 30 exceptions every year.I can't understand why everyone hates this so much. Is it because Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels weren't in it? If that's so, then let me ask you this. Since they've aged 9 years since Dumb & Dumber, do you really think they'd be perfect teenagers? Jim Carrey reached his 40th birthday in 2002! Overall, Dumb & Dumberer was 85 minutes of pure fun.

reviews.review_title: good prequel, but has major flaws. read below
reviews.content: to start things off, I am not jesse or chester right now...Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd (2003)Director: Troy MillerWritten By: Robert Brener and Troy MillerStarring: Eric Christain Olsen, Derek Richardson, Mimi Rogers, Cheri Oteri, Rachel Nichols, and Eugene LevyFirst, I just want to say that the idea of this movie is one of the greatest I have ever come across. We were going to finally see how Harry met Lloyd, and it was pretty funny how they did. I was very anxious to see this movie, and a good thing was its opening day was the last day of school for me so a few friends of mine and I went to go see it.--First Flaw: Characters.What I saw was Eric and Derek (ha ha) doing an amazing job of recreating Harry and Lloyd, but everyone else did a $hitty job being their characters, like Mrs. Heller and Principal Collins for example. Also, I thought Brener and Miller didn't know what they were doing because they kind of overexaggerated Harry a bit, like with the hair and the dumbererness.Second Flaw: Script.Too many of the jokes in the movie were give-away jokes, meaning they were given away before they happened so they weren't as funny. And also this line: Harry "I can't believe she's wewaring that outfit!" Lloyd "Yeah. Last time I wore those shorts I got beat up" and he was saying it like it was a bad thing, when earlier in the movie, he said Turk beats him up because he is cool.Third Flaw: Editing.There are many parts in the movie when you can see the black paint on Lloyds chipped tooth. Also, there were a few scenes that could've been done better or cut from the movie like the first convenience store scene when Lloyd introduces Harry to slushies.Fourth Flaw: Troy Miller.He did well in Mr. Show and is currently doing well in Viva La Bam, but he isn't as good as the Farrellys when it comes to movies.--Overall, this was a funny movie and was well written and directed at times. It would've been better if the Farrellys did it. 7.5 out of 10.-djt

This was, as far as I can remember, the least funny movie I have ever seen. Although I avoid the movies that I know will be lousy, like "Kangaroo Jack" and junk like "From Justin to Kelly", I really blew it with this one. The first movie had the strength of the comedic legend Jim Carrey, whereas this one has only two established actors, and they are playing the 'villians'. There was basically no story, and the only part that I laughed at was a scene where Bob Saget makes a cameo. Most of the movie even followed the structure of the first, including the ending! This certainly ranks as the most unnecessary prequel ever made. Now I know why Jeff Daniels and Jim Carrey stayed away from this project. A definite candidate for the worst movie of the year.

reviews.review_title: Witless, cretinous embarrassment of a film!
reviews.content: The three things I would be interested in knowing. (1) What idiot, and there IS no other word...greenlighted this thing having (presumably) read the early script? (2) Would it not have been patently obvious MAKING it...(not to mention from the daily rushes) that this was heading up to be one forgettable mess? (3) HOW in God's name did it ever gain release after the test-audience screening?DUMB and DUMBER was a classic, the two characters immortalised FOREVER in the collective public consciousness as Carrey and Daniels. NO-ONE else could EVER hope to play them and get away with it. You may as well slot in Woody Allen for BEN HUR!Even on its own account however, the film is a total dreck! Unfunny, unintelligent and just plain insulting!I didn't like this movie!

This movie was pretty much an okay flick. It was funny at some parts, although I think I liked Dumb and Dumber better (The first one) When I heard it was coming out, I was really excited because the first one was awesome. When I went to go see it in theaters with my friend, we found it to be really funny.The only bad thing about it is it doesn't have Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels. The first one was hilarious, I found it to be really silly. But this one doesn't meet up to it, but it's still a good movie.I would put it on a must watch list, you might really enjoy it.8 stars out of 10
The greatest line is "This house is full of ****!!" LOL and ROFL

Jim carry and jeff daniels are not in this and i am glad they weren't in it because this would have ruined there career 's which brings me to the original actor's aren't in it those two had personality these guys who replaced them are horrible the acting is terrible the directing is bland and boring this movie is also very ugly but the biggest flaw is the humor since this was the two thousands comedy's were just nothing but gross out humor and this is a prime example

Quite simply put, this is a terrible attempt at a movie. Troy Miller should go back to directing Mr. Show, and the people who starred in this film have probably ruined whatever careers they had. There are painfully few laughs as this thing lurches along. I think the main reason it seems so unfunny is the fact that the original film was one of the funniest movies made in the last decade. I have never laughed as hard since the original came out in 1994. I think I was even on the floor of the theater laughing during the snowman scene. Sadly, this sequel has nothing that will make you more than slightly chuckle. Please don't waste your $ on this one at the theater. If you must see it, wait until it comes out on cable next year.1 of 5  starsSo sayeth the Hound.

It doesn't happen a lot that a movie is really awful, but this is everything! It just isn't funny! The physical comedy is totally ridiculous! How hard Eric Christian Olsen and Derek Richardson try, there getting more embarrassing every minute. There is no way they can replace unthankfully replaced Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels. The harder they try, the worse it gets. Also the story is nothing. Even a children's movie has got a more intelligent story line than this film. Dumb and Dumber are such a great characters. As well as in the previous real movie as in the cartoon. Unfortunately, they really don't take advantage of it, because the movie is even dumber than the characters.So only watch this movie if you are really (and I mean REALLY) bored! Else: don't even bother to think about it! That's why I rate is 1/10.

Dumb & Dumberer is a classic example of a movie idea that will turn out 'bad,' no matter how 'good' you make it. I think the writers of this one did the best they possibly could with the idea... but it was doomed to fail from the start. The original Dumb & Dumber was a risky movie to film; there were so many areas in which the movie could fail, and the sequel manages to fail in all of them.Still, you may want to check this out if you want a quick laugh. Pretty much everything in here is a hit or miss, and while nearly everything is a miss, there are a few memorable moments that will manage to get a chuckle out of you. But if you want a true comedy classic, go rent the original.

reviews.review_title: Not the worst movie ever but not one third of the greatness of the first.
reviews.content: Dumb and Dumberer is a sequel to the Farrely Brother classic Dumb and Dumber and does not deserve the horrible rating it has got. The movie is about before the first movie or when Harry and Lloyd met each other in High School. The movie is a bit of a copy but brings a new look on the first one. The movie is good most of the time but like in the first movie they are pretty stupid in this movie they are the biggest pair of Retards ever and are beyond stupid. Overall this movie is good but nothing great. You should definitely watch this movie if you have nothing better to watch but should probably just watch Dumb and Dumber again and if you have not already seen Dumb and Dumber see it now. I rate this movie 62%. Also Eugene Levy is pretty good as the bad Principle.

reviews.review_title: Stupid, but not in the way Dumb & Dumber was stupid
reviews.content: I didn't have high expectations for this movie, which is the way you should go into this movie. I knew that it would be mediocre in comparison to the masterpiece that is Dumb & Dumber played by wonderful hilarious actors. Obviously, not everyone's going to like the fact that it's played by different people (including me.) It's enjoyable though there are some eye-roller moments. It's a fun movie that's easy to watch, especially if you're bored. If anyone expected a masterpiece, they probably came out of the theater wondering why they even bothered. But what do you expect from a sequel with different people playing the roles? It was just a bomb waiting to happen.

reviews.review_title: If you loved the original, you'll hate this; if you didn't like the original, this will seem kinda cute
reviews.content: The starring actors, who had some big shoes to fill, were excellent as both their characters and portraying the original actors. There were some genuinely funny lines. The plot needed strengthening and there were some extremely tiresome bits, but this movie is not at all as bad or as worthy of hatred as some of the comments and reviews would lead one to believe. It isn't a Farrelly Brothers comedy, it isn't a Jim Carrey comedy. As a light-hearted teen stoner comedy, it's cute. But if you're expecting the unique type of humor the Farrellys and Carrey are famous for, you'll be disappointed simply because this just isn't them. If it stood alone as summer fluff, there would have been a lot of fans who genuinely enjoyed it. Leave your preconceptions behind. Go into it with an open mind and without expecting a cinematic masterpiece, and you'll get some laughs.

Oh man, all this talk about sequels never being able to live up to the first movie really rings as true as ever in this case.This film is nothing but a pure rip-off, disappointment of the year, a complete waste of time, and even if you loved the first Dumb&Dumber movie, you'll even hate the original after watching this sequel (or rather, prequel).I have to say though, that the actor - unknown as he is and probably will remain - who plays the Lloyd character does a pretty good Jim Carrey-copy - but then again, what's the point when the film is as bad as this. No fun, just poop jokes - and although Harry's toilet visit in the original film was hilarious, thier attempt to copy it is disasterous..No madder if you like the first film or not; do not waste your time with this garbage, that's just free advice!!!

Whoever made this movie is a degenerative member of society. To take an amazing concept and destroy it must be an appealing task for the "idealists" that created this abomination of a sequel, but I was more disappointed with this movie than any other that I have seen. The reason for this is that I felt that "Dumb and Dumber", the original, was the absolute hands-down funniest movie I have EVER seen in my life. This movie, however, I would rank along with something like "The Hot Chick"... It's a movie that tried to be funny, but fell too far into the commercial grasp. Additionally, I was surprised as to how many recycled jokes were attempted... and failed miserably. This movie is terrible.

This movie was not really that good. First, it lacked Jim Carey, and b/c of this I don't think that the comedy was as funny. The movie actually discourages me to go see another D&D movie if it was created. For, the most part the movie included more stupidity than comedy.

reviews.review_title: I can smell your stinky finooter from here
reviews.content: I boosted the rating to a 9 because 3.5? Geez I don't get it, this movie is so funny. It blows away the most recent remake of dumb dumber. Shia labouf, Eugene levy, Cheri Oteri, Bob Saget..the scenes with Harry wearing Jessica mom's suit to dinner, the bathroom scene with the chocolate bar on the heater, Jessica "doing it" with Lloyd at the school, captain Rob getting punched..cmon this movie is great! Maybe it's just me but I could watch it every now and then and laugh..best time to watch it 4:20

reviews.review_title: I must have been dumb to have paid to watch that
reviews.content: Do I have to be DUMB to enjoy this movie? I am very upset and it was a waist of my sixteen dollars. I really think that the movie was a rip off only to make money. It is said I am struct by that show It wasnt funny it was stupid

Having read the reviews prior to seeing this movie I was expecting the worst. There are quite a few bad reviews. I was pleasantly surprised though. I watched it with my 10 year old kid and we both laughed heartily at a lot of the scenes. It was exactly as the title implies DUMB, which is what made it so funny. It was stupid, good stupid. If you don't compare to it to the original it stands on it's on own as a decent film. The pranks and jokes are quick and well... funny. I know there a lot of people who really hated this film and generally I agree with the majority on when a film is not good. This time I must disagree. It was very entertaining. Watch it with a kid and you'll enjoy it even more. Oh one thing in closing, Bob Saget did get a little annoying with the S word one too many times. It was funny the first 5 times but lost it.

If you have seen this movie some of you might of thought that it was good, but if you ask me this is the worst movie since Little Nicky. You must be thinking, what I am thinking, they should of made a sequel not a prequal, and I gave it 1.5/5. Absolutely terrible.

reviews.review_title: Doesn't capture the same effect as the first
reviews.content: The problem with this movie was that there was too much physical (unfunny) slapstick commedy. Moments of pure idiocy where young Harry and Lloyd simply play "tag" or slap eachother while drinking slushies infront of a convenience store. What made the original so funny was that it was a mix of funny slapstick comedy and situational comedy. There is little to no intersting situational comedy in this movie at all. This can be attributed to the terrible plot which I won't go in to right now. The only person in this movie who even got a smirk out of me was Cheri Oteri (past SNL actress). I have the first one on dvd, and I still watch it from time to time and it makes me laugh, with Jim Carrey you can't go wrong. But these two new guys they got in this movie just aren't goofy enough or funny enough to pull of younger versions of their characters. A good idea for a movie, just not executed well.

For me, the funniest part of Dumb and Dumberer was reading the insanely over-the-top press kit that accompanied the film. The kit uses flowery language to describe the filmmaking process as `a magnificent comedic journey,' and boldly states that this movie has `a little bit of something for everybody.' Lies. All lies. As we all know this movie is a prequel to the Farrelly Brothers 1994 hit Dumb and Dumber, which starred Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels as the chicken brained Lloyd and Harry. As inane as that movie may have been, it was funny in a gross way, and had some heart. Unfortunately, it also made a lot of money at the box office, which gave some genius the idea to make another movie based on the same characters. That all the main players of the original  the directors, writers and stars  have since priced themselves out of the market for a quickie cash grab like this didn't stop the producers from cobbling together a wide variety of second rate talents (and I use that word with a hint of irony attached) to present one of the least funny and ineptly made movies to ever play at your local multi-plex.

Haven't seen this movie for a couple of years. Watched Dumb and Dumber the other day then followed with Dumb and Dumber To,, so figured I'd finish the trilogy. Well,, if you like Dumb and Dumber,, you make like this movie, but it is sort of dumbed down, so to speak. Had some funny stuff, but kind of juvenile in terms of comedy. Although the other two aren't exactly sophisticated comedy. There was was funny stuff. The girl called Ching Chong and Lloyd trying to speak Chinese to her. Bob Saget was funny as Jessica's father. Small role but pretty funny. Also, Mimi Rogers should have been given an award for hottest mom or something. She really looked good in this. Other than that, it's back on the shelf. Maybe in a few years I will have forgotten what it's like and bring it out again.

This movie was a sacrilegious follow up to the original.  It should have never been created without the original cast.  The lines are terrible and who ever wrote the movie tried to take all of the one liners in the first one and put them in the second on.  Dont bother wasting your time or money on this piece of trash.

reviews.review_title: Incredibly stupid, horrible plot...but funny as hell
reviews.content: That's right, this movie has one of the most juvenile plots I have ever seen...I mean most comedies have crappy plots because we watch them for humor and a few good laughs, right?  Well, that's what you get with Dumb and Dumberer, a sequel that truly never needed to be made, but was very funny to say the least.No, it is nowhere near on par with the original, and it seemed like this one would have been a total stinkfest from the previews.  It certainly had a tough act to follow, no doubt, but amazingly it pulled it off.  There are a few acts that don't work, but there are never any real 'groaners'.  Funny movies like Van Wilder and Old School have their fair share of complete groaners in addition to funny parts, but this one is practically groaner free.  It flows almost haphazardly along, with pretty bad editing (I read somewhere that the original cut was close to 2 hours long!), but the short running time means that we are never really bored with what is going on. And yes, there are a few scenes of guilty pleasure childish delight that almost had me in tears, and many more that made me laugh out loud.  Sure the humor isn't for everyone, but I think if you lower your expectations, you will be pleasantly suprised.  I mean, how could you go into a movie like this with high expectations?The first one was a classic and is STILL FUNNY even today.  This one is a worthy successor, though slightly below par, which in this case, is still good.  The two actors truly mastered Carrey's and Daniels' mannerisms perfectly, which is half the fun (especially the actor playing the young Jim Carrey...he got his facial expressions down cold).  I don't usually rate movies like this that high, but I give this one an 8/10.  Why so high you may ask?  Well, it was a comedy, and though not ingenious, it kept me very entertained and provided many great laughs, a rarity these days.  I recommend this movie to those who can appreciate silly humor that concentrate more on humor than shock value. 8/10 stars.

reviews.review_title: This movie was SO BAD, I wanted to buy all the copies to BURN THEM!
reviews.content: In short? This movie is absolutely terrible. The plot line is terrible, the actors are terrible. When I watched it, I thought to myself "Why in the heck did I pay $6.00 to see this? As mentioned in my title, this movie is SO BAD, that I would love to buy every copy in existence just to burn them. I think one of the parts of the movie I hated the most was when they called the Asian girl "Ching Chong". Really? I know Asian people that saw the movie, and were highly offended at the fact that they would even fathom calling an Asian person "Ching Chong". However, there was one good part in the movie (The only good part)... Bob Saget and the "There's SH** EVERYWHERE! Ordeal. Best part of the whole movie. For those that want to see it, don't bother... it's not even worth it if it's in the $1 bin at Dollar Tree.

reviews.review_title: Stupid, Funny, and Better than most recent comedies.
reviews.content: I saw the trailer for this, and was quite excited. A few of my friends were not interested in seeing the film, as they stupidly believed that it is not possible to make a good second installment to a film without any of the original cast or crew. So i dragged my brother to see it. Within moments we were in tears of laughter.From the word go the film hits you with some of the silliest jokes you could imagine, and they work. From Lloyd thinking Harry's mum is the tooth fairy, to discovering that Lloyd's dad is in fact a latino school janitor (wonderfully played by the very charismatic Luis Guzman). Granted, most of the characters in the film are quite dumb, but that is what makes the film work. If, like in the 1st film, everyone except Harry and Lloyd were smart, the comedy would not work. You begin to understand why Harry and Lloyd are so incrediblly stupid. I also believe that if everything was the same as the 1st film, then people would just be saying "it is the same movie, nothing new".Troy Miller has definately proved that he can make a good comedy. He is on par with the Zuker brothers and Jim Abrahams. I would love to see a Troy Miller movie starring Will Farrell, Chris Kattan, and Leslie Neilson. With cameos by Adam Sandler, Ben Stiller, Owen Wilson and Rbin Williams. Obviously, by looking at my choice of comedians, you will begin to understand my sense of humour. So if you do not find these guys funny, then i recommend you give this film a miss. Stick to the more 'straight comedies' such as Legally Blonde (ZZZZZZZ!!).Derek Richardson has manged to mimic Jeff Daniels perfectly. It is very believeable to think he is a younger Daniels. Eric Christian Olsen brings something of his own to Lloyd. The voice is similar, but Olsen has obviously realised that mimicing Carrey will get him slated by critics and audiences, so Lloyd belongs to Olsen in this film.I loved this film. On DVD release, it will definately find it's way into my collection.I give it 4 out of 5.

reviews.review_title: Give this movie a chance will you
reviews.content: I don't understand why people come down pretty hard on this movie, I mean it doesn't come close to the excellent original but it's far from a total waste and I actually had a few good laughs when I watched it in the theater, even though the movie is highly flawed cause the movie was supposed to take place in 1986 but you see alot of 1990's cars in the background and remember the song 'Ice, Ice Baby' by Vanilla Ice, that song came out in 1990 not 1986 but other than that I thought that this movie was pretty good so if you liked the original Dumb and Dumber, then you'll like the prequel but don't compare it to the original.3.5 out of 5 stars

You guys should understand this :Without Jim Carrey, there goes Son of The Mask. Without Jim Carrey, there goes Evan Almighty. Without Jim Carrey, there goes Dumb and DumbeRER.But those are only facts that I've been thinking. The real opinion of mine doesn't depend on the movie actors, but the how the storyline should come from the first movie.They should've only been dumb and stupid, but goodhearted. In this horrible sequel, the director made them retards, a bunch of vulgar guys.I give 1/10 ratings on this one, fellas...

reviews.review_title: i knew this movie was going to be good, but i wasn't expecting this!
reviews.content: i did not think this movie was going to be as good as it was! this movie was hilarious! and to think "good morning america" rated this movie an F. an F?!?! i don't know WHAT they were on that day, but they said the acting sucked, the plot sucked, and there were no laughs. i think they sucked. if you are a big dumb and dumber fan, rush out and see this movie! it kicks ass! 9/10derek, good job. it was your first time being in any type of showbiz. what a great introduction

reviews.review_title: This is my first review. I love this movie!
reviews.content: This is my 1st time writing a review after being a huge fan of IMBD for years! 99% of the time, I dont start a movie without checking the rating here. I was highly upset to see this movie with such low ratings. This is one of my favorite comedies. It's one of those movies you have to watch twice to see its full potential. I've seen this more than I've seen the original and Jim Carry is one of my all time favorite actors. They chose the perfect cast. Its was awesome watching the making of this movie. They decided to keep everyone who tried out for the main casting and did their best to give them a part.Dont watch with high expectations and you wont be disappointed.

It really was not as funny as I thought it would be.  It definitely would have been better if it had the original cast of Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels. The original Dumb and Dumber was made almost ten tears ago, (1994). Wow! Time flies!  I remember seeing the original at Mission Drive in San Antonio. Oops enough nostalgia.The positive of this movie is that the make up was great.  Harry and Loyd looked exactly like Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels. I saw the actors in an interview without the makeup, and they are completely different looking. It was quite a transformation.   Unfortunately this movie was just plain boring and not very humorous.  One of the few funny scenes is when Harry pulls out a melted Hershey bar from his pants, and tries to get the chocolate off by rubbing it on the walls of the bathroom.  Jessica's dad played by Bob Saget cannot believe that he rubbed excrement all over his walls, and starts freaking out. 6/10

reviews.review_title: don't knock it till you tried it
reviews.content: Lets make no pretense. This is infantile stuff, a cartoon style plot with heaps of visual gags. The jokes are relentless, crude and altogether just not artworthy This film is no work of art but like a good cartoon you just watch it for the fun of it. I was simply crying with laughter at the toilet scene when the guy starts screaming about sh*t being all over his house. Its perfect The Jim Carrey playing guy was suitably deranged and the stroke of genius about this film is he played it realistically. He didn't do that 'I'm acting stupid in a stupid film' thing. Neither did the other half of this duo ... and his character was even dumber The rest of the characters were stereotypes (who cares, the whole point of them is that they are one dimensional and hence easy to laugh at) in what is basically a cartoon made into a film, I'm nearly 30 and I still make time to watch them No, the makers of D&D committed the cardinal sin of making a genuinely funny film with no pretense, hence the low marks It is worthy

I thought it was funny over all, but could have been better.  I think if the actors had just been themselves instead of trying to imitate Carrey and Daniels, it would have been a better film.  You just can't imitate the two of them and pull it off.

Many folks are going to hate this movie with a passion, but they'll be the ones missing out. I fully expected Dumb and Dumberer to be a bomb, but man was I surprised. The guys playing Harry and Lloyd are not only perfect, but they've got a hilarious supporting cast as well.Every member of the "Special Needs" class is quite a laugh. The scenes where they're all together had me rolling. Even the store clerk is a good laugh. Though, of course the stars of the show are Eric Christian Olsen as Lloyd Christmas and Derek Richardson as Harry Dunne. Playing a young Jeff Daniels and Jim Carrey in his prime is an insane challenge, but they pull it off flawlessly.The only flaw in this otherwise hilarious movie is the entire Principal scamming money plot. Not only is it dull, but Cheri Oteri and Eugene Levy are absolutely horrible. Not one scene of theirs is even slightly funny. Cheri Oteri is just yet another no talent SNL'er who's popular for no good reason. Thankfully they get very little screen time.If not for the lame Principal plot and acting, this would be a five. Don't let that stop you though, everyone else in the film turns in a terrific performance. This is the most I've laughed at a movie in quite a long time; It's more than worthy of the Dumb and Dumber title.Rirath_com

I had low expectations of this movie, kinda because the low rating on IMDB, but to my surprise this movie was really really funny... I gave it a 10, cuz it was never a dull moment, so dont let the low rating make you to miss this movie...

reviews.review_title: Hey! Wanna see the most annoying movie in the world?
reviews.content: Some prequels are pretty good. Some prequels are awful and then there's Dumb and Dumberer!! I understand some people didn't like it. I thought it was just eh!! Some parts are better than others.

reviews.review_title: Funny But Original Is Much Better
reviews.content: I just rented this movie today on dvd and yes it was funny and everything but still prefer the original one with "Jim Carrey" and "Jeff Daniels".  No matter what movie they choose to make a sequel to and/or several parts to it, the original will always be the better one of the two except for the movie "Jeepers Creepers" where I like the second part of it better.

reviews.review_title: why people don't like this movie
reviews.content: i think the reason people don't like this movie is that first, they expected or wanted to see jim and jeff reprising their roles.  second, they viewed it and compared it to the dumb and dumber original.  i went into the movie with no expectations and i found it to be hilarious.  i think as long as you don't think of the original, which probably is hard to do, then you'll enjoy this movie.  in its own way, its goofy, fun, and enjoyable.  me and my friends use a lot of the quotes from this movie and the first and we just laugh our a**es off.

I was very hesitant to watch this film.  From what I had heard, I would basically die if I watched it.  It was going to be that bad.  So I decided to try and cheat death. I watched it, gave it a chance, and I was surprised. It wasn't all terrible.  I thought most of it was in fact funny. The actors in their roles were good, and they even looked the part.  Who would want Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels to play teenagers anyway. (They are GREAT, but seriously).  There are many references to the first film included also. Fans will no doubt spot them on first viewing. don't listen to reviews of this film.  Check it out for yourself.  You might be surprised. I thought it was good fun.

it's such an hilarious movie! really, I've watched it several times and I always laugh as a maniac! I confess that the first time I saw it I was a little scared 'cause the first one with Jim Carrie was awesome, and I was afraid that this prequel could turn out to be, well, weaker. but no! great interpretations! great actors! great reveals! Eric, Derek, Shia! oh god, Shia is amazing! With all that hair... and those interviews that appear on the DVD, with Shia and his mum...such a nice guy. and such a great actor, with a great future! I really enjoyed this movie. simple but so funny... The characters are so perfect! those hairs... and I adore those scenes with that guy (sorry, don't know is name...) who is mad about football... awesome! definitely excellent!

One of the worst movies I've seen in the last 12 months bar none. This movie actually made THE RING and SIGNS look GOOD. When I saw THE RING and SIGNS, I was laughing throughout the entire movies. When I saw DUMB AND DUMBERER, I did not laugh one time, except for the Freda Felcher part. That is pretty bad when I laugh at movies that are supposed to be scary and just sit there with no expression during a movie that's supposed to be a comedy.There is a lot of good talent wasted on a TERRIBLE script. The guys that played Harry and Lloyd had the characters to a T! Good performances by Mimi Rogers, Eugene Levy, Cheri Oteri and others.Save your money.

reviews.review_title: One of the funniest movies ever made!
reviews.content: Besides Kung Pow:Enter The Fist Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd has to be one of the funniest movies ever made.From the beginning all the way to the end credits the film has nothing but gross outrageous humor and Eric Olsen plays the part better than Jim Carrey.For those who liked this one but still have yet to see the original don't cause it sucks.Dumb and Dumberer made up for the waste of the original.It's funny and actually has a point.If you like movies like Kung Pow and Jackass:The Movie(which I happen to love both of them)then this is the film for you.Some people can't appreciate funny movies but I am not one of those people.This movie is a must see and beats those crappy flicks like The Mask and the original Dumb and Dumber just to name a few.I recommend buying it!

reviews.review_title: Troy Miller, your days are numbered
reviews.content: I can't believe all you people went to see this movie because you thought it would be good.  The best thing about this movie is that it's supposed to be the crappiest thing anyone could imagine. I like how on one of the posters they have Harry and Lloyd with monkeys.  This movie would have been better if they had to drive a truck load of mischievous monkeys across the country and along the way stopped off in Vegas where they lose all their money and have to put on a musical monkey extravaganza to buy back their truck and deliver the monkeys to the slaughterhouse on time.  I guess they just didn't have enough monkeys to make it that way.

This might qualify as the worst movie ever made.  If there is a movie hell, this would be showing every night.  Please, I'm begging you, DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY/TIME ON THIS SORRY EXCUSE FOR A COMEDY!!!  I'm not usually a very harsh critic....but this was just plain bad.

First I must say that Lloyd in this movie looks VERY much as Jim Carrey. Even though much happend in this movie there wasn´t much of a story (nothing happend, just school)... A funny guy in the movie is the clerk with the long hair who gets REALLY annoyed buy Harry and Lloyds sick jokes and games.. =) But even though all this the movie is really good. I laughed several times to my death when I saw this movie..

I saw this movie today, and i must say it is funny. Lloyd is at Harry's house he asks, "can i have top bunk?" Harry says "Only if i can have bottom." HA HA HA!!!! Not as good as the first one but the actors are great. well worth seeing if your a dumber fan.7/10(I'm not on drugs. Its true.)

reviews.review_title: What does this series and Star Wars have in common? Prequels are not its forte.
reviews.content: It's just kinda uninteresting. Yeah, we get an introduction to the character, and all these other characters as well, but it really doesn't have much of an impact since we know we're never gonna see them again.

reviews.review_title: the bathroom scene is enough to get this movie a good rating
reviews.content: I just watched this movie within the last week or so even though MOST people I asked told me it wasn't THAT good (bottom 100 on IMDb) and I couldn't believe I was watching the same movie. This movie was FUNNY, REALLY FUNNY, way better than i expected. There are at LEAST 10 or more laugh out loud moments. All I can say is that most people must have been in bad moods when they saw this movie, (or was I in a really good mood) or they just wanted to see jeff danials and jim carry again. No friken way this movie is one of the worst movies EVER. This comment is mostly for anyone who can vote on this site to tell them to get this movie off the bottom 100. Anyone who wants to see this movie but have heard bad things about it, give it a chance.

It seems ironic that the running gag in this movie is the line "s**t all over the place."  As anyone could have assumed from the two months of advertisements without a single bit of footage, this movie is a new monuement to crappy sequels. As I assumed, the absence of Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels just make me want to cry about this movie even being made. This one ranks at about the same level as Jason X.  So if you want to see a movie that tries to reach the classic levels of its original creation, see this movie.  There were quite a few jokes that are pretty blatently stolen from 'Fast Times at Ridgemont High'.  I suggest just burning your $9, it will save you some time.

Just as hilarious as the original Dumb & Dumber. This movie sticks to comedy, not drama. It gets to the point, moves along well. A well-thought out movie that is not stupid. I give it a 10 out of 10 because I thoroughly enjoyed it. Good acting, good characters, good performances, good story. The movie is actually quite sincere. It's not pretentious.Why the low ratings and bad reviews by others? I came to this movie with no expectations or preconceived notions about anything or anyone. If they made this movie any better it would simply have been different, not better. Highly recommended. I also recommend "The 'Burbs" (1989) starring Tom Hanks.

I went to see a sneak preview of this movie just yesterday, and the audience, including myself loved it.  Yes, it sounds like I'm on crack but I really liked this one just as much as the first.  Maybe it was Bob Saget from Full House cussing up a storm, but I thought this movie was great.  I also liked the way that the actors they got to play Harry and Lloyd looked like the original actors.  I won't spoil the scenes for you, but I would strongly suggest that if you liked the first one, to go see this one.  The preview audience I was with was basically rolling in the aisles laughing.

reviews.review_title: An apt title; makes the original look like a masterpiece.
reviews.content: In the original Dumb and Dumber review, I said that it was a "reason to see comedies". For me, the original had a special place in my childhood, I've seen in many times since, and I still consider it to be the Farrelly Brothers' best work to date. Now here is a prequel (the execs probably thought, hey Lucas can do it, how hard can it be) and I think that, if anything else, it is an extremely pale reread/imitation of the original material. I'm not saying the movie is entirely laughless, in fact there were a few moments when I had a chuckle or two or some grins at the reckless ingenuity of the characters' stupidity (there's even one laugh out loud moment inside the "Special-Needs" classroom involving a quiet jock when he gets riled up by the other students). The problem lies in that any of the "original" jokes or gags have been done in so many other movies it can only be amusing after a while to the most slight of minds...which means that it will at least earn back a little of the money it took to make it. In other words, Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd is precisely for it's target group, and it doesn't aim for anything more or audacious like the original, and there's only a minor curiosity to see these two knuckleheads portray younger versions of Carrey and Lloyd. I didn't hate it, but when I left I wanted at least half of a refund. c-.

reviews.review_title: Of course it's not supposed to be serious!!!
reviews.content: Some of the comments about this movie say things like "only stupid people will find this funny" or things like that.To those people I say "You thought a movie called "Dumb and Dumberer" was dumb. Well Hollywood has your cash, and you're all upset because you were expecting something smart? Whos the real stupid person in this equation?"I thought this movie was just as funny, if not funnier than the origional. It's a laugh riot if you want it to be. If you go in thinking that you'll be better human being than you were when you woke up this morning, then of course you're gonna think this movie sucks.This movie was supposed to be stupid. IT SAYS IT IN THE FRIGGIN TITLE!!! I knew what it was going to be and I had so much fun.I did think it was funny that I seemed to be the mediator in the theatre when I went to see this flick. I noticed that people only laughed after I started laughing. It was like I deemed what was funny and what was acceptable to laugh at. I think a lot of the people in the audience were those expecting intellectual humor.If you thought the "Dumb and Dumber" was funny, see this movie. Forget the fact that it's not Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels. The actors they got are incredible in filling those big shoes. Now if they were any good in any thing else they were in... I can't say. But they were great choices for playing Lloyd and Harry.The only parts that weren't really funny were the scenes between Eugene Levy and Cheri O'Teri. They just didn't seem to click. They are both very funny people, but their scenes just weren't that funny. But I'll cut them some slack because they were needed for the plot to develop.

This is the worst movie I have ever seen, besides 'Sugar and Spice'.This was a complete waste of time, two hours of my life wasted. (It's okay though because I snuck into 'Dumb and Dumberer'. I can't believe people actually paid for this movie!)Some guy feel asleep in the theatre I was watching it and and began to snore. I, and the other people in the theatre thought that he was funnier than the movie! It was horrible-- the WORST experience I've ever had in theatres! This movie does not even come close to 'Dumb and Dumber'.It seems that 'Dumb and Dumber' is a masterpiece compared to 'Dumberer'. I hated it and did not even laugh more than two times-- no exageration!No one see this movie.I give it F.

I think that people that hated this movie should reconsider and actually watch the movie. people think that all because it is a remake, its going to be awful and tell the whole world that. this movie was a great movie and showed what happened to harry and lloyd in highschool and how they met. this movie was very funny, and cute. im not just saying this because i am a huge fan of eric christian olsen, im saying this to prove that this movie is an excellent movie and not to listen to what other people have to say about it and watch the movie for yourself to see what a cute and hillarious movie it really is.

reviews.review_title: i might get jumped for saying this....
reviews.content: i thought dumb and dumberer was a good movie. not as good as the first but descent enough not to be on the bottom 100 list. how can no one like a movie with cheri o teri in it? this was a good movie and i am glad to own it. whoever hasent seen it , watch it , don't listen to what other people say and watch it

I was shocked to come across the fact this is a bottom-rated movie. It is sweet, the 2 leads are likeable and funny, and it has one of the most laugh-out-loud 2-hit jokes of my 35 years as a film fan. I'm 40. The cast is great, if you're actually a film fan who's like a walking iMDB for actors, some still visible, some not. It's better than Dumb and Dumber To, overall. Eric Christian Olsen as Lloyd is hiwawious. Watch it, and ffs grow up. Not every film has to be Scorsese. It's funny, has Stifler's Dad (Eugene Levy) as a villain, has Bob Sagat screaming, twice, a total babe as a supporting character (Rachel Nicholls)... I could go on. Don't listen to the haters.

This movie has recieved a lot of criticism and some of it is deserved, but its not that bad. The 2 actors do a great job; on first glance it appears they are just copying the original Lloyd and Harry but thats the beauty-they have the characteristics down to a tee. There are some parts that contain just too much imitation of the first one and the writers have lacked originality, but it has its moments. If you like the first, which I rate as the funniest comedy so far, then you will gain some pleasure from this. The plot is not original which is disappointing but there are some laugh out loud moments. People who don't like slapstick need not apply here!

reviews.review_title: Not as good as first, but funny
reviews.content: I didn't have very expectations going into this movie but I was suprised as it was funny and good to watch. The two main characters had Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels to a T!  It was never going to be as funny as the first film but it had it's moments (especially harry's bathroom scene.) Overall a good movie that is easy to watch

Dumb and Dumberer is a great movie.  The casting of the characters harry and Lloyd were done very well.  If you watch dumb and Dumberer first then watch dumb and dumber it would look like to some one who has not seen them in the correct order that Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels are mimicking Olsen and Richardson.  These two pulled the characters off great.  The silly antics that these two go through are hilarious and I wouldn't suspect anything less from them.  They are the perfect people for stupidity.  I loved the movie, thought that it accented dumb and dumber very well.  Everyone should see this movie.  It gets a 10 from me.  It was the funniest movie I have seen in years.

WARNING TO THOSE WHO MAY NOT HAVE SEEN THIS YET: avoid this movie at all costs. Count to a million, start a used gum collection, bang your head against the wall until you pass out, do anything as long as it is not going to see this movie. Yes, it is that bad...In twenty or thirty years, the people of my generation may look back at Troy Miller the way many others look back at Ed Wood, Jr... as the worst director to ever make a movie. Yes, it IS that B-A-D. Eugene Levy, Luis Guzman, what the heck were you two thinking? This movie is stupendous in its badness.... triumphing in its apparent goal to challenge "Plan 9 From Outer Space" for the title of the worst movie ever made.There is nothing good to say about this movie, plain and simple. The plot is shotty at best, the acting is off the charts bad, and the dialogue is so incredibly bad that you start to think that the writers belonged in the "special class." This movie succeeds in damaging the legacy of its predecessor, which is an extremely funny movie that solidified Jim Carrey's status as the comic genius that he is, and that is a shame.
This movie should have never been made. The Farrelly brothers and Jim Carrey knew that it would not work, this should have been enough for New Line to not make this movie.Just think about how bad a movie must truly be for it to be carried by Bob "Full House" Saget in a two scene role. Troy Miller, please stop making movies now.

Not the best movie, obviously, but not nearly as bad as some people are saying! I'd heard this movie was horrible, so I went in with very low expectations, and came out quite pleasantly surprised. Eric Christian Olsen did spectacular, quite the change from his Not Another Teen Movie and The Hot Chick roles. The other guy did really well too.No surprise was how Shia LaBeouf managed to pull off his role insanely well. I've been a fan of his since the beginning of Even Stevens, and I pretend great things for his future. He's got three movies in theaters right now, he's just finished a successful show, and the current Project Greenlight film has him starring. He's super talented.Anyway. Dumb and Dumberer is obviously not as good as the original, but if you don't compare them it'll give you plenty of laughs and an enjoyable hour and a half.

Every time I watch this movie its still funny, the story takes place in the 80's (one of the photos show this) and in the movie Lloyd is the son of the school janitor, him and Harry both fall for Jessica but they stop around the end of the movie because they knew it would ruin their friendship, but in the first movie when they are older they still fall for the same woman, and just like the last movie, theres a scene where Harry is in the bathroom and something bad happens. I know this would make alot of people mad, but I give this movie a 8 out of 10

I saw the trailers, noticed Eugene Levy and Cheri Oteri were cast, and was amazed at how close the two young actors looked like Carrey and Daniels from the original.  I thought I was in for a treat.Sadly, it was mostly painful to watch.  Lowbrow humor amuses me - don't get me wrong, I loved the first film - but this one just couldn't pull it off the way the Farrelly brothers did it.  Bob Saget shouting about poo was funny the first time, but hearing him continue to shout just got lame after 10 seconds or so.  And when a similar scene came up near the end...   well, just forget it.A few amusing scenes...  The opening scene with incident with the doctor. - How Lloyd chipped his tooth. - The note Lloyd left for his dad. .....  that's all I can think ofsigh....   at least it was a slightly cheaper matinee...Galto

Compared to the first movie this movie is NOT a disappointing sequel, (err, rather, prequel?). The casting was right on target, nobody else could have pulled off Harry and Lloyd as teenagers and done it such a brilliant manner.Everything about Dumb and Dumberer fits right along with the second movie, which seems to be a major feat in Hollywood. Never once was I left thinking "Oh Harry (or Lloyd) would never have said or done THAT!".Not quite as humorous as first movie, but still pretty darn hilarious and wacky.If you liked Dumb and Dumber, you'll definitely love this movie.

reviews.review_title: Olsen twins couldn't have saved it
reviews.content: This was quite possibly the worst sequel ever made. Hmmm. I'm trying to remember a worse sequel. Most sequels aren't as good, but they're not usually horrible. (exception, the 'Scream' franchise and 'I still know what you did 400 summers ago' franchise sucked pretty bad) Contrary to popular theory, casting was not the problem. The writing was terrible. I loved the original. It was the Farrelly's bros at their best. The orig. had a clever story. The joke of this movie is, "whoa these guys are so stupid..ha ha." I almost walked out of the theatre. Bob Sagat does make the movie enjoyable for the 20 seconds he's in it. The talented Olsen twins couldn't have even saved this movie. Why can't people make good comedies? Good comedy, meaning a movie that's clever that you'll laugh at. Anyways. I'm out.

I saw dumb and dumber years ago in the cinema and thought it was 'the best thing since sliced bread' and when I heard they were making another one I was so happy and wondered how this could top the origional and when I saw it I realised as anyone who are put through it will that they didnt try to top the original they tried to destroy it. I feel sorry for the cast of this who will have one hell of a fight saving their careers. I mean the carachters were so dumb and the ending prodictable.

The original Dumb and Dumber, to me, was a classic.  A film that will forever remain in my private collection of DVDs.  It wasn't only the subtle humor in the first film, but also the scenic locations they used.  From RI to Aspen, we were along for the trip, amused with each scene building upon the last.  But, what humor can be found from this film?  What story-line are we exposed to?  The answer is none.  I was particularly impressed with the portrayal of Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels that these two new actors gave, but this was the only impressive part of the film.  I know I cannot expect a "high-class" comedy with a film like this, but none of the jokes worked in this film.  None of the blatant puns or overused "one-liners" even remotely gave the impact of the first film.  Although, I will concede that the scene with Bob Saget and the Hersey's Bar was enough to crack a smile, but this still does not justify spending 8 bucks.  This felt more like watching a film written by and staring Rob Schneider. Dirp. 1/10

reviews.review_title: Good lead actors, bad writing and directing
reviews.content: The story was lame, not just dumb. The scatalogical jokes were constipated. The scenes between the principal and his lover were pathetic. The best part of the movie was the imitations the new actors did of Jim Carey and Jeff Daniels. Too bad they will never get a chance to do it over. The writing was simply putrid.

reviews.review_title: This movie caused vomiting, headaces, and then I left.
reviews.content: Trash is all I have to say. I mean I gave this movie the hope of it being funny but it was just horrable. One of the many problems is they make them too dumb. I mean in this one they think getting beat up is a type of showing ones love. Levy's charecter gave me hope that it would be a litle funny, wrong! There is nothing funny I saw, t was killing me so when they did the gag of Harry looking at a state and hearing it talk onlt to be shocked that it was someone next to him, I left. I walked out and I could tell all the Dads watching that movie with there kids wanted to join me. So this is a great attempt of butchering up a classic, I hope to relieze never to make a sequel if the orginal crew or cast rejects it for being so stupid!

reviews.review_title: Thanks Hollywood... you've managed to swindle my money once again.
reviews.content:
I see there are a few people that actually liked (no, LOVED) this movie... I am going to keep tabs on them and make sure I stay away from anything they recommend... ever.I cant say that this production was the absolute worst thing Ive seen, because that would have to mean it fails on all cylinders.  I didnt laugh at all, but I did stick around to watch the superb performance by Eric Olsen. He nailed Jim Carrey's character of Lloyd Christmas perfectly, no one else could have even come close.  Although it was a shame this role was ever resurrected.What is so sad is that the production company knew it was god-awful, yet still pumped about $15 million into hype advertising, praying to break even.
Thanks Hollywood... youve managed to swindle my money once again.

Dumb and Dumber was the funniest movie I ever saw, but this latest sequel was no fun to watch. I really only remembered only one funny scene, and the rest of the movie was pointless comedy, (If it is even called comedic). They tried to make the personalities of Lloyd and Harry way too similar to the "older" Lloyd and Harry. Except these two actors could not do the jokes well at all.

Eric Olsen did an amazing job playing a character that was already established by such a highly regarded actor.  I normally don't consider movies such as these as humorous, but the role was played so exquisitely that I was enraptured by Olsen's performance throughout the entire movie.

Catching the first teaser that came out on cinemas I was very excited about this movie since I thought it would be a Jim Carrey movie. Later I realised it was not and was kind of disappointed.. still, I had my hopes up when watching a sneak preview.But gosh was I wrong, altho the actors do a decent job in portraying the young Harry & Lloyd, it's just simply not as funny. Instead it rolls out into an average 'stupid-comedy' a la a bad sequel of Police Academy.The jokes are too few and when they do pop up they're not allt that funny. Too much time is spent on the characters actually getting into character.Naw, just a bad sequel living on the hype of it's prequel. One of many. Stay away from this one, and if you have to catch it, I'd wait and get it on VHS/DVD.3/10

The original hasn't aged well but was extremely in the time period. I can't imagine anyone from a newer generation laughing at any of the original either. It was funny for the dark shock humor but we've had shows like Jackass since then. The original was the perfect movie at the perfect time for that sort of comedy. That time is over. There was no way to recapture that again so this movie was doomed from the start of filming.

reviews.review_title: Not as great as the first, but I enjoyed it
reviews.content: This is one Fantastic movie! When Harry let Captain Rob run into the car I was in laugher. I discovered Ms.Heller A.K.A The lunch lady said Quesideas whatever-you-call-it in a weird way. Her nose twiched when she said it. I liked Lewis because I saw him in Holes. Many Complain about this film, Jeff Daniels and Jim Carrey hated it. I laughed when Harry was covered in chocolate at Jessica's house. At first I thought it was poop, so did my bro, GET THE PICTURE DUMB AND DUMBERER HATERS?!

reviews.review_title: Rachel Nichols is what made the movie worth watching
reviews.content: she made the movie worth watching...especially her in the two piece bikini. mmm mmm mmm. otherwise, the whole movie blew. and if anyone thought this movie was great, they have a poor sense of humor. this movie sucked along with the nutty professor 2. a giant BOO to both films

As a huge fan of the origional Dumb and Dumber I saw this movie, even though everyone I talked to said it was horrible.  This movie should have went strait to video.  I left the theater half way through the movie because it was so bad.  The actors did a good job with what they had, but the script is just terrible.  If you want to see this, definately wait for it to come out on VHS or DVD and watch it.  I'm glad the Jeff Daniels and Jim Carrey did not get involved in this because they are both much better actors than what this script could even dream to offer.
