reviews.review_title: Bob Saget sumbed it all up
reviews.content: Bob Saget correctly summed up this movie in one word.  See the movie, and you'll know what that word is.  It had its moments, I admit, that I enjoyed and were funny. Some of the gags were just plain stupid.  The whole thing lacked direction, as evident by the montage scene and the deleted scenes over the credits.  To me it seemed the writer and director had a whole load of gags that they knew were good for laughs, but just couldn't find a believable way to connect them all.  This film will find its audience, just like Adam Sandler and Tom Green have their audiences.  Different people find humor in different things.  I just didn't find the majority of the film to be funny, it was just stupid.

Ok, this movie was made for dumb people, unlike the first movie which was one of my all time favorites. I actually registered so that I can let everyone know how terrible this movie is. Avoid this at all costs.There is no story line to speak of. The situations are not even intersting and the actors are horrible. I did not laugh even once during this movie, infact I nearly cried that I was watching this horrible movie. I cannot imagine why this movie is such a disaster when the first was sooooo good.

This movie was not funny. The only reason I give it a 3 is because the actors did a decent job portaying the originals. The only time I laughed was at Bob Saget. What does that say about a movie? Bob Saget is funny and all, but is he usually the most memorable piece in a flick? I feel soo bad for the actors, they did a great job.

This movie is pathetic at best. The original actors are gone from the movie...which made it watchable in the first place. My main question is why? There are so many mid name stars they should have cleaned house of them and brought back carrey/daniels. who cares to see cheri oteri, eugene levy, mimi rogers, luis guzman, bob sagat, etc. ? Use that money to bring back the actors who are irreplaceable. Another problem is there are too many things in this movie that are taken from the first....no spoilers just take my word. My advice....wait for dumb and dumberer to come out on dvd then trick a friend into renting it so you dont feel ripped off.

reviews.review_title: Not an Oscar Winner-but what the Hell did you expect?
reviews.content: I give this film a very respectable 6. It would've gotten a 7 if it wasn't for my cousin constantly reminding me that it wasn't as funny as the original at every chance.Were this film not a 'prequel' but released before the original it may have been given half a chance. But if your the kind of person who thinks that different actors ruin a movie then you wont like it. If your a 'silly-film-lover' like myself or even just a general film lover then I advise you to give it a chance! Granted - Carrey and Daniels are classics-Carrey is one of my all time faves! But surely without the writers, a film is nothing? Well it's the same writers so that must mean something-and I think Richardson and Olsen were brave to step in to such legendary shoes - but you'll never please everybody, I s'pose.

reviews.review_title: Goofy and dumb, but has a certain charm over it
reviews.content: Even though many fans of the first one will probably be dissappointed with this one, it can't help but there's a charm which will make you like it.It tells the story where Harry and Lloyd meet in high school.Derek Richardson makes an awesome debut as the part of young Harry. Eric Christian Olsen is also good as young Lloyd. 7.5 out of 10 stars.

reviews.review_title: People actually thought this was funny???
reviews.content: I saw the movie so don't tell me not to bash it until I've seen it -- This movie couldn't not have been any worse -- The first movie was great but this one couldn't make a 8 year old laugh -- The jokes were not funny and half of them were from the first movie anyways -- The Bob Sagett cameo has already been done before and much funnier (Half Baked) -- Eugene Levy goes from making great movies like The Mighty Wind to this piece of junk?? -- Come on Eugene I know you have talent so why waste it -- I think I laughed maybe once in this movie (when he says "someone chipped my tooth" "someone bit my forehead") and I think anyone could have come up with a joke as funny as that -- Honestly will someone who liked this movie please tell me what was so funny about it -- EVERYONE WHO HASN'T SEEN IT PLEASE TRUST ME -- RENT THE ORIGINAL AND WATCH IT AGAIN INSTEAD -- I would have rather done that myself -- I think if I watched the original again I would have laughed a lot more -- I promise you this movie is THE WORST comedy since "Not Another Teen Movie" and this is even worse -- Pathetic -- The actors did a decent job -- Harry and Lloyd were not bad but the script was incredibly terrible -- If someone says "Its not supposed to be a great film its just a fun comedy" then you are an idiot -- I know its supposed to be stupid but stupid is an understatement for this movie -- Billy Madison was stupid but I laughed my @$$ off -- Never have I seen such a disappointing film -- I went in with ZERO expectations and I was still let down* out of *****

reviews.review_title: It almost put me to sleep
reviews.content: Out of the hour and twenty minutes or so, I laughed about approximately thirty minutes.  Sure Harry and Llyod were all right, but Eugene Levy was wasted and not a single thing he said was ever funny, Cheri Oteri was boring and both of them together were on the screen too much to be enjoyed.  Bob Saget made a return to the big screen but overplayed his part and was a little bit exaggerated.  Not enough to save the movie to be a disaster except the same jokes used in a different manner.  Half the movie jokes were based upon the original's and it just wasn't good enough.

OK let me start off by saying that this is a funny movie, but its one of those movies that are so stupid that its funny. look back on attack of the killer tomatoes. that also was a stupid movie but you had to laugh. the plot of dumb and dumber takes off when loyed bumps in to harry and become friends but when harry is going out with jessica harry saw jessica kiss loyed and they are not friends anymore until he brought a snow yeti from the museum and they became friends again. for people who like movies that are stupid that you have to laugh this is a movie for you. The thing that I think was the funniest is were they play tag in the store that reminded me of my friend mike. back to the subject I rate this movie a 4.5 out of 5.

This is my first review on IMDB and I don't know exactly what a spoiler is so do not read this if you have not seen the movie. I've been waiting a long time for this movie. I thought it was brilliant that they made the characters younger. It allows the change in actors since they were younger and look a little different. It took me about 15 minutes to acclimatize to the new actors, Lloyd nailed it and it took me a little while to get Harry. I don't think they built the girls reason why she was doing an investigation into the principle of the high school. But every thing other then her doing the investigation was hilarious.The two guys were actually retarded in this movie and you can see that in the first movie they were smarter. I hate bob sagat humor but after half-baked and this movie I have a different opinion of him as an actor. The chocolate bar scene started out a little fishy, but was dam good once I figured it out. I loved the shopping cart chase scene and the brain freeze scenes had me cracking up.I see a dumb and dumberer first road trip sequel. And I am crossing my fingers that a dumb and dumber original sequel can be made with the original actors. And even a third version called grumpier old dumb and dumber men.The part that made me laugh the hardest was when the credits were rolling and they had the out takes. A person behind me said they should have left those parts in. I'm guessing in the editing process scenes were cut that explained more about the movie. I bet the DVD will have a completely different version and have a lot of the out takes.I was not disappointed and enjoyed this movie and would recommend it to anyone who loved the first movie.
1. Bad Script 2. Bad Direction 3. Bad Casting 4. No Jim, No Jeff 5. No Farrelly Brothers 6. Painful and Embarassing to Watch 7. Awful, Just God Awful!Mostly it was just a bad idea that didn't work.

I have seen dumb and dumber a lot and it is one of my favorite movies of all time.  I have waited forever for it to make a sequel and they make a stupid prequel.  I haven't seen this movie so I can't tell you how bad it was but I am not going to see this piece of crap Jim carrey and jeff daniels I think are one of the best comedy duos of all time.  I am very mad!

reviews.review_title: Stupidest Film Of The Year Award?
reviews.content: That was one stupid film!  Everything I expected though, a poor sequel, or rather prequel. :)  It had some funny parts however which made me laugh. It was nice and short, but nothing like the original.  Not worth spending money in the theater though, maybe a video rental?  5/10

When I was on my way to see this movie, I had a horrible feeling in my stomache and my consience was telling me that I had made the Dumbest mistake ever. I did not want to break my grandfather's heart because he took me to see this as a treat, so I didn't listen to my conscience and went in to see the movie. When I came out about 2 hours later, I said to myself "Were those newspaper critics on crack or something?" All the reviews I have read of this movie were saying that this movie was crap. I thought the movie was EXELLENT!!!!! This movie is top-notch stuff. I found the friendship brewing between Harry and Lloyd touching. I of course pointed out a few jokes from the original Dumb and Dumber, but still, If You like Dumb and Dumber you have to come see this movie.This movie (in my opinion)deserves 10/10.

Terrible movie......I only laughed twice...but man many a times I wanted the movie to just end....I wanted to shout stop the movie...it's hurting..... I found that the movie on many occasions did not deliver a punch line to many jokes or just that the punch line was not funny at all...... I was really disappointed even though I loved the first movie this one was really disappointing....**** spoiler *************** another thing that bothered me was that the plot was very stupid and that Harry and Lloyd weren't the ones who stopped the evil ones in the movie.

reviews.review_title: In the words of Bill and Ted this is film is EXCELLENT!! (riff)
reviews.content: God's honest truth this film is very very good, its written by the Farey Brothers the guys who wrote the original Dumb and Dumber, and you can tell, ok its not Jeff Daniels and Jim Carrey but it is a close as you could possible get. This film has been slagged off by every film critic, but when have has a film critic ever been right? The film starts off with the meeting off Harry and Lloyd, and their relationship develops, they have to put together a "Special" class, this "Special" class allows the school to get a $100,000 grant which the head master plans to run off with, with the help of jessica, Harry and Lloyd foil his plot infront of the whole school. A very funny film in the TRUE sense of dumb and dumder.

reviews.review_title: As bad and badder: Somebody owes me money
reviews.content: I believe that somebody owes me $12 (one ticket for my girlfriend and I) for that horrible movie.  I have never gone into a movie with lower expectations...and I was still disappointed.  This is the worse movie I have ever seen.  However, I will give props to the guy who played Lloyd Christmas.  He did a great impression.  That's the best I got.

I went into this movie not expecting much and that is exactly what i got not much. The movie had very few laughs. While watching I just kept wondering how much longer is this movie going to last. This movie could have been so good. The actors they got to play lloyd and harry were perfect it was just and dumb movie. It isnt even close to the original. This is quite possibly the worst movie i have ever paid to go and see. If you wanna see a funny movie rent the original dumb and dumber.

I went into this movie *expecting* the worst. That's right. I knew it was going to be terrible and I saw it anyway. I had this whole plan of how I was going to ruin it for everyone by laughing way too hard at jokes that were really unfunny, just to make everyone turn and look at me and think "what's wrong with you", and repeat back lines that weren't witty at all, adding "that's so funny" and etc. Well, my little game got boring fast. After about 5 minutes, no one was responding at all to my little outbursts, so I just stopped and watched the movie. After twenty minutes of the movie, I was so annoyed and bored with the movie that I walked out.This movie is the first movie I have ever walked out of. I'm quite the masochistic movie-watcher. I'll watch anything. This movie couldn't even maintain *my* interest. I laughed at the one scene where Lloyd wrote a message for his father in gigantic ketchup letters, but it wasn't a sustained laugh, and it was the only real one.1/10, definitely. I've probably seen worse movies, but none come to mind right now.

Do not, under any circumstances, give your money to the clods that filmed this attrocity.This is one of the worst movies I've ever seen.  There is nothing redeeming. The plot is horrible and the movie consists of nothing but predictable gags between ripoffs of the first movie - from the fire at the gas station to the bathroom scene - it's all been ripped off and performed   so horribly that it will detract from the wonderful experience you had watching the original.Please, do yourself a favor, go watch the original again and don't EVER watch this. You will regret it.

I thought this movie was great.  Although the second half was lagging a bit and I found myself missing Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels.  It's not a horrible film but you will find yourself wondering why you're still laughing.  And remember that Wednesday is Southwest day in the cafeteria.

reviews.review_title: Plotless movies lead to very short summaries, much like this one...
reviews.content: I didn't like the first movie, but I went to see this one with a friend because she really, REALLY wanted to go.This movie is 82 minutes long.  When I left the theater, however, I felt like I had been there for hours and hours.  I laughed a few times, but mostly the movie was incredibly uncomfortable and embarrassing to watch. The jokes were shallow, predictable, and weren't even funny.  Not even Eugene Levy or Shia LaBeouf were laugh-worthy.  Sadly enough, only Bob Saget should get any credit for laughs here.  However, "Harry" and "Lloyd" actually captured their older counterparts quite well.Another major problem I had with this movie was the anachronisms.  No matter how stupid or amateurish the movie may be, if it's supposed to be 1986, at least put in some other than dressing everyone up like it's a bad 80s dance party.In short, don't even bother seeing this movie unless you really enjoyed the first one, or you're too young to drive yourself there and you plan to entertain yourself by farting the entire night and kicking the back of everyone's seat in front of you, because that's what the 3 incredibly immature kids behind me did, which made the movie even worse.

Dumb and Dumberer is just FUN! I really like it, Great film, I think Eugene Levy is great in every film he is in and this one is the same. Stop slagging this film of, Its just light hearted fun! Buy the DVD or video! If you like it of course!

What on earth was I thinking when I willingly purchased a ticket for this abysmal attempt at a prequel? I know that prequels/sequels generally never live up to the expectations of the original, but I feel I must applaud Troy Miller on setting a new benchmark that sequels must stay well clear of.The movie starts off by showing us a little bit of Harry's (Derek Richardson) childhood and a 'hilarious' experience with his imaginary friend. And take it from me folks, it gets worse. What follows is 90 minutes of pure cinematic dung. From the distasteful (a scene in which Harry appears to smear faeces on a bathroom wall) to the downright confusing (a not so funny `your it' sequence in a convenience store).My view after watching the 1994 original was that Lloyd and Harry were just two buddies that were caught up a world that was just moving too fast for them. However, in this movie, Miller puts them across as being mentally disabled and so incompetent that they may not even develop into the people they are in the 1994.The film takes every single hilarious scene from the original and milks it relentlessly, so much so that you may find yourself cringing when a line from the first is said. Don't get me wrong, I LOVED the original, it is one of my favourite comedies but this shoddy knock-off has the ability to discourage a person from watching the original.The cast list looks attractive on paper. Eugene Levy, Luis Guzman, Mimi Rogers and Cheri Oteri have all starred in fine comedies over the past few years but this movie is one I think that would be better left off the résumé. Eric-Christian Olsen on the other hand may be one of the lucky ones, and this may actually benefit his career. His perfect take-off of Jim Carrey is flawless in both mannerisms and accent. He even managed to get a chuckle out of me in a scene involving him using a floor buffer on a sidewalk.
All in all, this movie is a complete waste of time and money for the cinema patron. If you want a laugh, rent the original. Its jokes are still as funny as they were in 1994, however, I can't see us looking back in 2012 in reminisce this movie.1 out of 10

I found this movie quite entertaining, and it definitely gave my room mate and I some great laughs. Of course it was ridiculous, it is supposed to be! Anyway I give props to the actors too, they did a great job, over all a cute entertaining movie.

I came into the movie expecting a disappointment, but I got more than that. They tried to use jokes from the first movie, but failed miserably.  The only part of this movie that kept it from being a complete failure was the fact that Bob Saget says sh*t about 50 times. Thats the only good part. Seriously. Don't waste your time or money, even when it comes out on DVD.

I came into the movie expecting a disappointment, but I got more than that. They tried to use jokes from the first movie, but failed miserably.  The only part of this movie that kept it from being a complete failure was the fact that Bob Saget swears about 50 times. Thats the only good part. Seriously. Don't waste your time or money, even when it comes out on DVD.

An absolutely wonderful experience. I am a huge fan of the original and I was very pleased with this installment. Eric Christian Olsen, and Derek Richardson did an exquisite job of portraying Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels. If they had cast anyone else, the movie would not have been as good. They were absolutely perfect. I plan on seeing it again. Defiantly worth the asking price.

I work at a movie theater, so I was able to see Dumb and Dumberer today. I was also able to see it for free. I would honestly not recommend paying to go see this movie; wait until you can rent it. The actor that plays Lloyd is really pretty good, I was impressed with his performance. However, the actor that plays Harry shows his inexperience. He almost looks like the original Harry, but he's just not quite goofy enough. If you look at the movie poster, it's very obvious that he's just not suited for the role. The only actors that are worth seeing in the movie are Eugene Levy as the principal of the high school and Cheri O'Teri as the "special needs teacher." Oh, and I can't forget Bob Saget screaming obscenities in two different scenes in the movie. Those two moments are priceless, something you don't expect from somebody as straight-laced as Bob Saget. Other than those three, the other characters in the movie really don't capture your attention.I honestly haven't sat down and watched all of the first one, but this one definitely disappointed me. There are a few good scenes, but overall not a good movie.

reviews.review_title: What? There was a second Dumb and Dumber?!
reviews.content: Talk about disappointment.  The whole time I was watching this movie my friend and I shook our heads in shame as the two main actors (playing Harry and Lloyd) tried to impersonate the infamous Carrey and Daniels' jokes from the first movie.  It just isn't happening.  From the "I LIKE IT ALOT" to the "It" game, the movie just flunked in the joke area and impersonations.  It was full of potty humor, that mainly kids would enjoy. I will admit.  I did laugh at a few parts in the movie.  For example, best part - Bob Saget swearing at the top of his lungs. However, just as most of us thought, this movie was a pitiful attempt to try and recount the hilarious movie of 1994.  No Farrelly Brothers, no Jim Carrey, no Jeff Daniels!  You know it's going to be a flop.  One of the best parts of the first movie was the quality songs that went along with the plot (i.e. "The Flower Girl", "Boom Shack-a-lak", "Oh Pretty Woman", etc.). This movie was void of a good soundtrack.  Save your $8.25 and wait until this comes out on video. P.S.  - Sorry to Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels - this movie is an embarassment to your brillance and laughter you created in the first movie. YOU SHOULDA BEEN IN THE SECOND ONE!Rating:  C-  (2 out of 5 stars)
I've Spent one hour and a half waiting for the Storyline and it turns out that these 90 minutes are Supposed to be the Storyline.It's soooooooo boring and useless.

reviews.review_title: Coulda been done without the Dumb and Dumber name.
reviews.content: They could have done this movie without it being the prequel to dumb and dumber.  Most of the jokes related to the original dumb and dumber aren't even funny.  The movie does have it's moments though, like the scenes with Bob Saget.  It didn't even bother me that these guys weren't Jeff Daniels and Jim Carrey.  One of the major gripes i had with this movie was when it explains the origins of Lloyd's chipped tooth.  When they run into each other you can clearly see that their heads don't even come close to touching.  I give this movie a 5 out of 10.

reviews.review_title: shockingly better than i thought it would be......
reviews.content: ok so i am a big fan of the first dumb and dumber and when i saw the teaser for the sequel i thought it was going to suck big time so when it did come out i didnt rush to see it but i just saw it and i have to say it is a pretty funny movie i admit not close to as funny as the original but i think if u like the first as much as i did you will like this one too.

Most would watch this movie, expecting humor to jump right out and captivate them... however, this is the type of movie you have to watch expecting lame humor. If you're a fan of the "Scary Movie" trio filled with lame humor, or better yet, Old School, Anchorman (the original or the 2nd version), or any movies of the sort, then Dumb & Dumberer is for you.I, personally, enjoyed this movie... my favorite part being the beginning (the dancing scene is probably one of the best ever, aside from Napoleon Dynamite's dancing attempt and the dance scene from 2005's "Hitch").8/10 on this movie, most definitely.

reviews.review_title: A Fitting Name For A Movie
reviews.content: Never, in the history of cinematography, has a movie had such a fitting title.  No, I'm not referring to the intelligence of the two "stars" of the movie, but instead of the movie itself.  Dumb and Dumberer was simply that. It started off dumb, and just got plain dumberer.  Never in my entire life have I been so bored and unentertained that in those 82 minutes.  The movie is pointless!  A crooked high school principal tries starting up a phony special needs class so he can receive a $100,000 grant from the school board, so he and his girlfriend (the school lunchlady) can run off together to Waikiki.  I really do feel bad though for Eric Christian Olsen and Derek Richardson who looked and acted EXACTLY like their famous counterparts, but were shorted with a cheap script, no jokes, and even worse, predictablity and THE SAME LINES from the original movie.  I gave this movie a 1 out of 10 on the imdb scale, which is GENEROUS considering there are no 0's on there. This was by far the worst sequel and arguably the worst movie of all time. America and the World, if you see this movie, you can't be any dumberer.

This movie is hilarious. Yes, it's goofy, immature humor, but it's done so well in this film. If you like anything that Will Ferrell or Adam Sandler does, then you'll love this movie. The constant subtle idiocy is what makes this film great. The two main actors that play Harry and Lloyd are perfect for their roles. They work amazingly together and they are great younger versions of the original two actors from the first film. I personally liked this one better than the original. this movie does a nice job of showing just how Harry and Lloyd met and became the ultimate duo that you know from the original. I actually wouldn't mind seeing another film made to make this a trilogy. Don't listen to the people that say this movie is dumb and pointless. See it for yourself and then make your decision.

this was without a doubt the worst movie i've ever seen. i am so glad i didn't have to pay to see it. filled with a cast of non-talented actors, and actors who completely destroyed their credibility by appearing in the movie, this was a complete disaster. no wonder jim carey made a point to say he had nothing to do with this flick...who would want to...

This movie is everything I expected. I saw it yesterday and I just knew it would turn out to be a "funny, but stupid" movie. Also, I think Dumb and Dumber is funnier than the prequel (considering the fact that Carrey and Daniels are in it, who are funnier). But if you like what I like to call "immature comedy" then you'll love it! Overall, I'd say it's OK on a borderline level....if that makes any sense...

I had the unfortunate opportunity to see a sneak preview of Dumb and Dumberer last night.  This movie (not film) did not have ONE redeeming quality.  People were leaving the theater a half hour into the film.  I however was not as smart as said people and left with about a half hour left.  DO NOT see this movie.  It is not even "dumb funny", it is just boring and was a big mistake from the beginning.  Trust me, this movie is a waste of two hours.

reviews.review_title: You have got to be kidding me!!
reviews.content: Is this it?  Is this the movie I have been waiting to see?  Horrible, disgusting, and amazing how unfunny this movie is!  I LOOVEED Dumb and Dumber...great movie...p*ss your pants funny, but Dumb and Dumberer is a direct slap in the face to it's sequel.  Don't pay to see this movie, download it...no...no...not worth the time.  OH, and is it just me or does anyone else feel robbed?!Peace

reviews.review_title: I want my two hours back...
reviews.content: The title of the movie goes perfect for this flick. To bad its not funny :\ Personally I didnt think the first one was overly impressive either... But this one had a poor cast of no name actors, who arent overly funny, and writters who arent sure exactly what humor is. The plot: not so good, a few funny lines here and there... reviews.review_title: I have never seen a worse movie.
reviews.content: This movie blew. Not only was it not funny (at all) but it just overall blew. The plot was as stupid as the movie tried to be. There was a slight shining star throughout the darkness, however, Bob Saget was slightly funny in his role but it didn't make up for the rubbish that was called the rest of the movie.

I saw a special screening last night.  WOW! What a let down.  I usually like those kinds of movies (Dumb and Dumber, Tommy Boy, etc.), but his one was awful.  Not that there should be a great plot in these types of movies, but this one went nowhere.It seemed that the producers just put this out to make a buck.  This movie really had a lot of potential, but just didn't utilize it; like it was just thrown together over the weekend.  There were only two scenes that were funny, the rest was just infantile filler to make it 90 minutes long. You could definitely tell that the Farrelly Brothers had nothing to do with it.In short, worse than Weekend at Bernie's II (1993).

The whole story line and everything was so corny I almost got up and left, but I payed $6.50, and I wasn't gonna waste my money. I feel like I did though. There were only a couple funny jokes but the rest of the movie was unoriginal.  I can't believe this movie made it to the theaters.  It was a complete waste of time and money and I strongly recomend not seeing it. It recieves 1 out of 10 stars, and thats being generous!

This was one of the most disappointing movies I have seen in a long time. Dumb and Dumber was such a classic movie that I expected nothing less from this one.  However, I knew it wouldn't be up to par because it wasn't directed by the Farrelly brothers and the two previous stars Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels weren't in it.  Also, the movie used the same jokes as in the first one only they weren't as funny the second time (especially since I've seen the first one about a hundred times).  All in all, this movie was nowhere near as funny as the original and I was thoroughly disappointed.

After seeing this I still believe that the first one was a product of its time that everybody loves because of nostalgia because this movie is actually pretty accurately made to fit in with the first one. Even though it's clear what the general consensus is with this movie, it doesn't feel like a quick cash grab to just cash in on the popularity of the original and actually has a few throwbacks to the original, some more obvious than others. And this movie actually has the added bonus of providing a scene that I laughed harder at than anything in the first movie.

Now, saying that doesn't mean I like the movie and it's a blessing and a curse at the same time. While the tone and humor is similar to that of the first to fit in with the timeline and characters, it also means that I didn't really laugh a lot either. I noticed I had a few more chuckles sprinkled throughout this time but that's because of the references to the first and the little jabs here and there at certain things, the joke about doing nothing and fitting in, in America made me smile. The scene that I laughed at though I thought would raise the score up a little but nothing else like that happened again and the joke happened a little too early in the movie. The reaction one character has to something that happens in their bathroom had me laughing a lot, his reaction was what made it funny, it's a gag joke a little different from the rest. Even the dream sequence was better in this movie, it was more creative and just as soon as I thought it was going on too long, it finished! Which is unlike the other movie. The movie also has the problem that was in the first with someone saying a joke and cutting away seconds after they say it, it didn't happen that often but it was still there. Also, the opening credits were funny again, woo, and it even has 'Joon 13' on the cover.

I think the actors that played Harry and Lloyd were well chosen, they looked the part and acted like a young Harry and Lloyd would, they were written the same way and acted the same way, it's believable and well done. The plot was also like the one from the first movie, things just keep going wrong for our characters who are always in the wrong place at the wrong time and totally oblivious to what's going on. The side characters were good, especially the ones in the 'special class' even if they weren't used as much as I would have liked and Eugene Levy is always there for a good laugh, even if he wasn't as funny like he usually is but it was probably the script, you can only do so much. And some of the acting isn't the best either. It also does have some very odd cameos.

While I've said it fits in with the previous movie, it did feel quite cheap which is probably where some of the criticism comes from but hey, at least it's short. Dumb & Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd might not be that great, it is much like the first movie and it's harmless and you even find out how Lloyd chipped his tooth. It's innocent enough and once again has likeable characters in the lead but it's clear what everyone else thinks. Some call it pointless and even though I thought that a few times, when you get right down to it, every movie is pointless. I personally don't think it's the monstrosity that the majority seem to think it is but that's just the beauty of an opinion, it's not a masterpiece but neither was the original and hey for what it's worth, this one actually made me laugh.

The stupidity continues as the comedy goes old school in the prequel Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd.  Set in their carefree high school days in 1986, Harry and Lloyd become the unwitting pawns of a corrupt principle who's attempting to embezzle state funds by creating a fake "Special Needs" class.  Featuring Eric Christian Olsen, Rachel Nichols, Eugene Levy, and Shia LaBeouf, the casting is pretty good; Olsen in particular does a great job at emulating Jim Carrey's performance from the original.  And the comedy is well-written, staying true to the first film and offering several homages.  Still, the film tries a little too hard to be like the original and doesn't quite have the same spirit.  Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd is fun and entertaining, but it plays things kind of safe and sticks to a standard high school comedy formula.

The two lead actors are quite convincing in their stupidity and you will find yourself laughing at a few jokes but overall it lacks the typical touch of the Farrelly brothers who have a special knack to portray uncanny characters in silly situations and write excellent jokes.

There's a fine line between dumb enough to make a hilarious movie, and so ridiculously dumb that it's hard to even let out a nervous laugh here and there. Though the original DUMB AND DUMBER was a good example of a former, this prequel is theThere's a fine line between dumb enough to make a hilarious movie, and so ridiculously dumb that it's hard to even let out a nervous laugh here and there. Though the original DUMB AND DUMBER was a good example of a former, this prequel is the perfect example of the latter. DUMB AND DUMBERER: WHEN HARRY MET LLOYD is more of an homage to DUMB AND DUMBER than anything. The form of "dumbness" isn't even similar to the original, there is no similar plot, and it looks like two truly-smart teenagers imitating the believable stupidity of Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels. All in all? This isn't worth watching. For fans of the original DUMB AND DUMBER, you'll begin to miss the real Jim Carrey because of the awful impersonations you'll find here.

rt_summary: After years of homeschooling, dim-bulb teen Harry Dunne (Derek Richardson) finally makes the leap to public school and meets the equally intellectually challenged Lloyd Christmas (Eric Christian Olsen). The duo land in a "special needs" class created by Principal Collins (Eugene Levy) in order to bilk money from parents to fund his condo in Waikiki, Hawaii. His corruption is discovered by Jessica (Rachel Nichols), a fellow student who asks Harry and Lloyd to help her prove Collins' guilt.
meta_summary: In the 80s, Harry and Lloyd meet in high school where they cross paths with a mean principal and a bunch of other outcasts much like themselves.
